  {
    "type": "text",
    "text": "Perfect! Now I have a comprehensive understanding. Let me create a summary report of my findings:\n\n## Frontend and Backend Exploration Summary\n\n### Current State Analysis\n\n#### 1. Frontend Pages Currently Exist (c:\\Users\\ravic\\development\\karmyq\\apps\\frontend\\src\\pages)\n\n**Public Pages:**\n- `index.tsx` - Landing page with registration/login options\n- `login.tsx` - User authentication\n- `register.tsx` - User registration\n\n**Core User Pages:**\n- `dashboard.tsx` - User's main dashboard showing matched help requests and active requests\n- `profile.tsx` - User profile management with skills management and community memberships\n- `notifications.tsx` - Notification management\n\n**Community Pages:**\n- `communities/index.tsx` - Browse/discover communities with filters (search, location, category, sort)\n- `communities/new.tsx` - Create new community\n- `communities/[id].tsx` - Community detail page with three tabs:\n  - Overview: Shows community stats\n  - Members: Lists members with their roles (shows invite button for admins)\n  - Norms: View and propose community norms\n\n**Help Requests/Offers Pages:**\n- `requests/index.tsx` - List help requests\n- `requests/new.tsx` - Create new request\n- `requests/[id].tsx` - Request detail\n- `offers/index.tsx` - List offers\n- `offers/new.tsx` - Create new offer\n- `messages/index.tsx` - Messaging hub\n- `messages/[id].tsx` - Message thread\n\n**Key Finding:** NO DEDICATED ADMIN PAGES EXIST\n\n---\n\n#### 2. Community-Service API Endpoints (c:\\Users\\ravic\\development\\karmyq\\services\\community-service\\src\\routes)\n\n**Communities Route (communities.ts):**\n- `GET /communities` - List communities with filters\n- `GET /communities/my/communities` - Get user's communities\n- `GET /communities/:id` - Get community details with members\n- `POST /communities` - Create community (creator becomes admin)\n- `PUT /communities/:id` - Update community (admin only)\n- `DELETE /communities/:id` - Archive community (admin only)\n\n**Members Route (members.ts):**\n- `GET /communities/:communityId/members` - Get members with status filter\n- `POST /communities/:communityId/join` - Join community (public=auto, private=pending)\n- `POST /communities/:communityId/members` - Add member (invite)\n- `PUT /communities/:communityId/members/:userId` - Update member role/status (admin only)\n- `DELETE /communities/:communityId/members/:userId` - Remove member or leave (admin can remove others)\n\n**Norms Route (norms.ts):**\n- `GET /communities/:communityId/norms` - Get norms with optional status filter\n- `GET /communities/:communityId/norms/:normId` - Get norm with approvals\n- `POST /communities/:communityId/norms` - Propose norm (members only)\n- `POST /communities/:communityId/norms/:normId/approve` - Approve norm\n- `DELETE /communities/:communityId/norms/:normId` - Remove norm (admin or creator)\n\n**Settings Route (settings.ts):**\n- `GET /communities/:communityId/settings` - Get TTL/decay settings\n- `PATCH /communities/:communityId/settings` - Update settings (admin only)\n- `GET /communities/:communityId/settings/decay-preview` - Preview decay effects (admin only)\n\n---\n\n### Current Community Management Features on Frontend\n\n**Admin capabilities visible in [id].tsx:**\n- Admin role detection (line 166: `isAdmin = role === 'admin' && status === 'active'`)\n- Invite button shown only to admins (lines 312-318)\n- Invite modal exists but shows placeholder \"Coming soon\" (lines 148-161)\n\n**Regular member capabilities:**\n- Join community (public or request-to-join for private)\n- View members list\n- Propose norms\n- Approve norms (when in proposed status)\n- Simple majority rule for norm acceptance (>50% of members)\n\n---\n\n### What Admin Features Are MISSING\n\n#### Frontend Admin Pages/Panels:\n\n1. **No Admin Dashboard** - Community admins have no dedicated dashboard to:\n   - See pending join requests for private communities\n   - Manage members (approve/reject joins, remove, change roles)\n   - View community settings\n   - See community statistics\n   - Audit logs/activity\n\n2. **No Join Request Management** - Private community admins cannot:\n   - View pending join requests with messages\n   - Approve or reject applicants\n   - Accept/deny individual requests\n\n3. **No Community Settings Page** - Admins cannot access:\n   - TTL configuration (request_ttl_days, offer_ttl_days, etc.)\n   - Reputation decay settings (half_life_months)\n   - Activity type configuration\n\n4. **No Member Management Interface** - Missing:\n   - Bulk member actions\n   - Role assignment UI (member to admin promotion)\n   - Member removal UI\n   - Member blocking/warning system\n\n5. **No Moderation Interface** - Missing:\n   - Norm management (approve/reject/archive)\n   - Content moderation\n   - Community rules enforcement\n   - Violation tracking\n\n#### API Endpoints Exist But Frontend Lacks UI:\n\n- `PUT /communities/:communityId/members/:userId` - Change roles/status (NO UI)\n- `DELETE /communities/:communityId/members/:userId` - Remove members (NO UI)\n- `PATCH /communities/:communityId/settings` - Update settings (NO UI)\n- `GET /communities/:communityId/settings/decay-preview` - Preview decay (NO UI)\n- Invite endpoint is partially stubbed (shows \"coming soon\")\n\n---\n\n### Admin Operations API Is Complete, Frontend UI Is Not\n\n**Summary:** The backend API has comprehensive admin functionality, but the frontend lacks dedicated admin pages to:\n1. Manage pending join requests\n2. Manage members (roles, removal)\n3. Configure community settings\n4. Track community activity\n5. Moderate content and norms\n\nAll these operations currently require community admins to use API calls directly rather than an intuitive UI."
  }
]

    "text": "Perfect! Now let me create a comprehensive report of the mobile app exploration:\n\n## Mobile App Exploration Report\n\nBased on my thorough exploration of the KarmyQ mobile application, here's what I found:\n\n### 1. Current Project Structure\n\nThe mobile app is located at `c:/Users/ravic/development/karmyq/apps/mobile/` with a clean, modular structure:\n\n```\napps/mobile/\n├── app/                    # Expo Router file-based routing\n│   ├── _layout.tsx        # Root layout with push notification setup\n│   ├── index.tsx          # Entry point (auth redirect)\n│   └── (tabs)/            # Tab navigation layout\n│       ├── _layout.tsx    # Tab bar configuration\n│       └── feed.tsx       # Personalized activity feed (ONLY IMPLEMENTED SCREEN)\n├── services/              # API and service integration\n│   ├── api.ts            # Axios-based API client with interceptors\n│   └── notifications.ts  # Expo push notifications setup\n├── store/                 # State management (Zustand)\n│   └── auth.ts          # User authentication state\n├── app.json              # Expo configuration\n├── package.json          # Dependencies\n├── tsconfig.json         # TypeScript configuration\n└── README.md             # Comprehensive setup guide\n```\n\n### 2. Screens and Components Status\n\n**Implemented:**\n- Feed Screen (`(tabs)/feed.tsx`) - Shows personalized community activity with refresh, empty states, and item navigation\n\n**Planned but NOT Implemented (defined in layout but missing files):**\n- Communities screen\n- Requests screen\n- Messages screen\n- Profile screen\n- Auth screens (login, register) referenced in layouts but not yet created\n\nThe tab bar configuration is set up with icons for all 5 planned tabs, but only the feed screen has actual implementation.\n\n### 3. Dependencies and Configuration\n\n**Key Technology Stack:**\n- Framework: React Native with Expo SDK 50.0.0\n- Navigation: Expo Router 3.4.0 (file-based routing)\n- State Management: Zustand 4.4.7\n- HTTP Client: Axios 1.6.0\n- Notifications: expo-notifications 0.27.0\n- Location: expo-location 16.5.0\n- Camera: expo-camera 14.0.0\n- Maps: react-native-maps 1.10.0\n- Icons: react-native-vector-icons 10.0.3\n- Storage: expo-secure-store 12.8.0\n- Animation: react-native-reanimated 3.6.0\n\n**API Configuration:**\nThe app uses a microservices architecture connecting to multiple backend services via ports:\n- Auth Service: Port 3001\n- Community Service: Port 3002\n- Request Service: Port 3003\n- Reputation Service: Port 3004\n- Notification Service: Port 3005\n- Messaging Service: Port 3006\n- Feed Service: Port 3007\n\nBase URL is configured via `Constants.expoConfig?.extra?.apiUrl` (defaults to `http://localhost:3001`)\n\n**Platform-Specific Configuration (app.json):**\n- iOS Bundle ID: `org.karmyq.app`\n- Android Package: `org.karmyq.app`\n- Permissions configured for: Camera, Location, Photo Library, Storage, Notifications\n- iOS info.plist has proper permission descriptions\n- Expo Router and notifications plugins configured\n\n### 4. Steps Needed to Test on iOS/Android Simulators\n\n#### Prerequisites:\n1. Node.js 18+ (verify with `node --version`)\n2. npm or yarn\n3. Expo CLI: `npm install -g expo-cli`\n4. **For iOS**: macOS with Xcode and iOS simulator\n5. **For Android**: Android Studio with Android emulator installed\n\n#### Setup Steps:\n\n**Step 1: Install Dependencies**\n```bash\ncd c:/Users/ravic/development/karmyq/apps/mobile\nnpm install\n```\n\n**Step 2: Ensure Backend Services are Running**\nBefore testing the app, you need the backend services running:\n```bash\ncd c:/Users/ravic/development/karmyq\ndocker-compose up  # or use infrastructure/docker/docker-compose.yml\n```\nThis starts all 7 microservices on the required ports.\n\n**Step 3: Configure API Connection**\nThe app currently points to `http://localhost:3001` by default. For simulators:\n- **iOS Simulator**: Can reach localhost directly\n- **Android Emulator**: Needs special configuration to reach host machine:\n  - Modify API URL to `http://10.0.2.2:3001` in app.json, OR\n  - Use `adb reverse` command to forward ports\n\n**Step 4: Run on Simulator**\n\n**iOS:**\n```bash\nnpm run ios\n```\nThis automatically opens iOS simulator and starts the development server.\n\n**Android:**\n```bash\nnpm run android\n```\nThis automatically opens Android emulator and starts the development server.\n\n**Or use interactive mode:**\n```bash\nnpm start\n```\nThen press:\n- `i` for iOS simulator\n- `a` for Android emulator\n- `w` for web (debugging)\n\n#### Troubleshooting Commands:\n\n**Clear Expo cache:**\n```bash\nexpo start -c\n```\n\n**Reset Metro bundler:**\n```bash\nexpo start --reset-cache\n```\n\n**Android port forwarding (if using localhost instead of 10.0.2.2):**\n```bash\nadb reverse tcp:3001 tcp:3001\nadb reverse tcp:3002 tcp:3002\nadb reverse tcp:3003 tcp:3003\nadb reverse tcp:3004 tcp:3004\nadb reverse tcp:3005 tcp:3005\nadb reverse tcp:3006 tcp:3006\nadb reverse tcp:3007 tcp:3007\n```\n\n### 5. Current Implementation Status\n\n**What Works:**\n- Basic authentication flow (login/register implemented in API layer)\n- Push notification setup and handlers\n- API client with token-based auth and automatic 401 handling\n- Zustand store for auth state management\n- Feed screen with pull-to-refresh\n- Tab-based navigation structure\n- Secure token storage\n\n**What's Missing/Incomplete:**\n- 4 of 5 tab screens not yet implemented\n- Auth screens (login/register UI) not implemented\n- Communities, Requests, Messages, Profile screens\n- Components directory is empty (no reusable UI components)\n- Hooks directory not implemented\n- Types/interfaces directory not created\n- Error boundaries and advanced error handling\n- Offline support mentioned in README but not implemented\n- WebSocket for real-time messaging mentioned but not connected\n\n### 6. Testing the App\n\nRun tests:\n```bash\nnpm test              # Jest unit tests\nnpm run type-check    # TypeScript type checking\nnpm run lint          # ESLint validation\n```\n\n### Key Files to Review:\n- `c:/Users/ravic/development/karmyq/apps/mobile/app/_layout.tsx` - Root navigation setup\n- `c:/Users/ravic/development/karmyq/apps/mobile/services/api.ts` - All API endpoints\n- `c:/Users/ravic/development/karmyq/apps/mobile/store/auth.ts` - Auth state management\n- `c:/Users/ravic/development/karmyq/apps/mobile/app/(tabs)/feed.tsx` - Only implemented screen example\n\nThe mobile app is well-architected but in early development stages with only the feed screen implemented. The foundation is solid with proper routing, API configuration, and state management setup."
  }

Tool reply2025-11-22T21:09:44.937Z
[
  {
    "type": "text",
    "text": "Perfect! Now I have all the information I need. Let me compile my findings:\n\n## Schema Issue Analysis Report\n\n### 1. Location of feedComposer.ts\n**File Path:** `c:\\Users\\ravic\\development\\karmyq\\services\\feed-service\\src\\services\\feedComposer.ts`\n\n---\n\n### 2. Schema Reference Issues Identified\n\nThe feedComposer.ts file has **several critical schema mismatches**:\n\n#### Issue 1: Wrong Table Name - `requests.requests`\n- **Code References:** Lines 69, 174, 184, 197, 272 and throughout the file\n- **Code is looking for:** `requests.requests`\n- **Actual Table Name (from init.sql):** `requests.help_requests`\n- **Problem:** The table is defined as `help_requests` (line 91 in init.sql) but the code queries it as `requests`\n\n#### Issue 2: Wrong Column Name - `helper_id` in requests.matches\n- **Code References:** Lines 185, 493, 498 (in queries using `m.helper_id`)\n- **Code is looking for:** Column `helper_id` in `requests.matches` table\n- **Actual Schema:** The `requests.matches` table (lines 120-129 in init.sql) has a column named `responder_id`, NOT `helper_id`\n- **Related Issue:** Queries also reference `m.status = 'proposed'` but should likely use other statuses based on context\n\n#### Issue 3: Wrong Column Name - `user_id` vs `requester_id`\n- **Code References:** Line 273 uses `r.user_id` when querying requests\n- **Actual Schema:** The `requests.help_requests` table (lines 91-104 in init.sql) has `requester_id`, not `user_id`\n- **Problem:** Inconsistent field naming between code expectation and actual schema\n\n#### Issue 4: Non-existent Column - `required_skills` as array\n- **Code References:** Lines 67, 270, 335, 370\n- **Code is looking for:** `r.required_skills` as an array column\n- **Actual Schema:** No `required_skills` column exists in `requests.help_requests` table\n- **Problem:** The feedComposer assumes requests have skill tags, but this column doesn't exist\n\n#### Issue 5: Column Name Mismatch - `urgency` column type assumption\n- **Code References:** Lines 267-289, 302\n- **Code is querying:** `r.urgency` with CASE statement expecting 'urgent', 'high', 'medium'\n- **Actual Schema:** Column exists but code treats it correctly (line 98 in init.sql: `VARCHAR(50)`)\n- **Status:** This one is OK\n\n#### Issue 6: Non-existent Column - `community_id` in requests.matches\n- **Code References:** Line 511 in RLS policy references `community_id` in messaging.conversations\n- **Problem:** Not directly in feedComposer but related - messaging.conversations only has `request_match_id`, not `community_id`\n\n---\n\n### 3. Correct Schema Based on init.sql\n\n**Feed Service Schema (CORRECT - Lines 371-402):**\n```sql\nCREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS feed;\n\nCREATE TABLE feed.preferences (\n    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,\n    show_community_activity BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,\n    show_open_requests BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,\n    show_completed_exchanges BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,\n    suggest_adjacent_requests BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,\n    exploration_level VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'balanced',\n    show_explanations BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,\n    show_broader_stories BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,\n    allow_public_featuring BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,\n    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,\n    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP\n);\n\nCREATE TABLE feed.dismissed_items (\n    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),\n    user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,\n    item_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,\n    item_id VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,\n    dismissed_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,\n    UNIQUE(user_id, item_type, item_id)\n);\n```\n\n**Requests Service Schema (ACTUAL - Lines 88-135):**\n```sql\nCREATE TABLE requests.help_requests (\n    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),\n    community_id UUID NOT NULL,\n    requester_id UUID NOT NULL,  -- NOT user_id\n    title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,\n    description TEXT NOT NULL,\n    category VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,\n    urgency VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'medium',\n    preferred_start_date TIMESTAMP,\n    preferred_end_date TIMESTAMP,\n    status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'open',\n    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,\n    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP\n    -- NO required_skills column\n);\n\nCREATE TABLE requests.matches (\n    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),\n    request_id UUID NOT NULL,\n    offer_id UUID,\n    responder_id UUID NOT NULL,  -- NOT helper_id\n    status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'proposed',\n    completed_at TIMESTAMP,\n    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,\n    updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP\n);\n```\n\n---\n\n### Summary of Critical Issues\n\n| Issue | Location in Code | Current Reference | Correct Reference | Severity |\n|-------|------------------|-------------------|-------------------|----------|\n| Table name error | Lines 69, 174, 184, 197, 272 | `requests.requests` | `requests.help_requests` | CRITICAL |\n| Column name error | Lines 185, 493, 498 | `m.helper_id` | `m.responder_id` | CRITICAL |\n| Column name error | Line 273 | `r.user_id` | `r.requester_id` | CRITICAL |\n| Missing column | Lines 67, 270, 335, 370 | `r.required_skills` | Column does not exist | CRITICAL |\n\nThese schema mismatches will cause all queries in feedComposer.ts to fail at runtime with table/column not found errors."
  }
]

Assistant2025-11-22T21:09:57.095Z
⚙ Read
{
  "file_path": "c:\\Users\\ravic\\development\\karmyq\\services\\feed-service\\src\\services\\feedComposer.ts"
}
Tool reply2025-11-22T21:09:59.113Z
     1→import { query } from '../database/db';
     2→import {
     3→  FeedItem,
     4→  FeedComposition,
     5→  UserBehavior,
     6→  CommunityActivity,
     7→  OpenRequest,
     8→  SuggestedRequest,
     9→  Story
    10→} from '../types';
    11→
    12→export class FeedComposer {
    13→  /**
    14→   * Calculate feed composition ratio based on user behavior
    15→   */
    16→  async calculateFeedRatio(userId: string): Promise<FeedComposition> {
    17→    const behavior = await this.getUserBehavior(userId);
    18→
    19→    // New users: More exploration
    20→    if (behavior.communities_count <= 2 && behavior.recent_helps_count <= 3) {
    21→      return {
    22→        your_communities: 40,
    23→        suggested_requests: 40,
    24→        broader_stories: 20
    25→      };
    26→    }
    27→
    28→    // Active users: More from their communities
    29→    if (behavior.recent_helps_count > 10) {
    30→      return {
    31→        your_communities: 70,
    32→        suggested_requests: 20,
    33→        broader_stories: 10
    34→      };
    35→    }
    36→
    37→    // Standard: Balanced
    38→    return {
    39→      your_communities: 60,
    40→      suggested_requests: 25,
    41→      broader_stories: 15
    42→    };
    43→  }
    44→
    45→  /**
    46→   * Get user behavior metrics
    47→   */
    48→  private async getUserBehavior(userId: string): Promise<UserBehavior> {
    49→    // Get recent helps count (last 30 days)
    50→    const helpsResult = await query(`
    51→      SELECT COUNT(*) as count
    52→      FROM requests.matches m
    53→      WHERE (m.helper_id = $1 OR m.helpee_id = $1)
    54→        AND m.status = 'completed'
    55→        AND m.completed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days'
    56→    `, [userId]);
    57→
    58→    // Get communities count
    59→    const communitiesResult = await query(`
    60→      SELECT COUNT(*) as count
    61→      FROM communities.members
    62→      WHERE user_id = $1
    63→    `, [userId]);
    64→
    65→    // Get user's skills (inferred from completed helps)
    66→    const skillsResult = await query(`
    67→      SELECT DISTINCT unnest(r.required_skills) as skill
    68→      FROM requests.matches m
    69→      JOIN requests.requests r ON m.request_id = r.id
    70→      WHERE m.helper_id = $1 AND m.status = 'completed'
    71→      LIMIT 10
    72→    `, [userId]);
    73→
    74→    // Get user registration date
    75→    const userResult = await query(`
    76→      SELECT created_at
    77→      FROM auth.users
    78→      WHERE id = $1
    79→    `, [userId]);
    80→
    81→    return {
    82→      recent_helps_count: parseInt(helpsResult.rows[0]?.count || '0'),
    83→      communities_count: parseInt(communitiesResult.rows[0]?.count || '0'),
    84→      skills: skillsResult.rows.map((row: { skill: string }) => row.skill),
    85→      member_since: userResult.rows[0]?.created_at || new Date()
    86→    };
    87→  }
    88→
    89→  /**
    90→   * Compose full feed for user
    91→   */
    92→  async composeFeed(userId: string, limit: number = 20): Promise<FeedItem[]> {
    93→    const preferences = await this.getUserPreferences(userId);
    94→    const composition = await this.calculateFeedRatio(userId);
    95→    const dismissed = await this.getDismissedItems(userId);
    96→
    97→    const feed: FeedItem[] = [];
    98→
    99→    // Calculate item counts based on composition percentages
   100→    const yourCommunitiesCount = Math.floor(limit * composition.your_communities / 100);
   101→    const suggestedRequestsCount = Math.floor(limit * composition.suggested_requests / 100);
   102→    const broaderStoriesCount = limit - yourCommunitiesCount - suggestedRequestsCount;
   103→
   104→    // 1. Your Communities Activity (if enabled)
   105→    if (preferences.show_community_activity || preferences.show_open_requests) {
   106→      const communityItems = await this.getCommunityActivityItems(
   107→        userId,
   108→        yourCommunitiesCount,
   109→        preferences,
   110→        dismissed
   111→      );
   112→      feed.push(...communityItems);
   113→    }
   114→
   115→    // 2. Suggested Requests (if enabled)
   116→    if (preferences.suggest_adjacent_requests) {
   117→      const suggestedItems = await this.getSuggestedRequestItems(
   118→        userId,
   119→        suggestedRequestsCount,
   120→        preferences,
   121→        dismissed
   122→      );
   123→      feed.push(...suggestedItems);
   124→    }
   125→
   126→    // 3. Broader Stories (if enabled)
   127→    if (preferences.show_broader_stories) {
   128→      const storyItems = await this.getBroaderStoryItems(
   129→        userId,
   130→        broaderStoriesCount,
   131→        dismissed
   132→      );
   133→      feed.push(...storyItems);
   134→    }
   135→
   136→    // Sort by priority and created_at
   137→    feed.sort((a, b) => {
   138→      if (a.priority !== b.priority) {
   139→        return b.priority - a.priority; // Higher priority first
   140→      }
   141→      return b.created_at.getTime() - a.created_at.getTime(); // Newer first
   142→    });
   143→
   144→    return feed.slice(0, limit);
   145→  }
   146→
   147→  /**
   148→   * Get community activity items
   149→   */
   150→  private async getCommunityActivityItems(
   151→    userId: string,
   152→    limit: number,
   153→    preferences: any,
   154→    dismissed: Set<string>
   155→  ): Promise<FeedItem[]> {
   156→    const items: FeedItem[] = [];
   157→
   158→    // Get user's communities
   159→    const communities = await query(`
   160→      SELECT c.id, c.name, c.description
   161→      FROM communities.communities c
   162→      JOIN communities.members m ON c.id = m.community_id
   163→      WHERE m.user_id = $1
   164→      ORDER BY m.joined_at DESC
   165→    `, [userId]);
   166→
   167→    for (const community of communities.rows) {
   168→      // Get community activity stats
   169→      const statsResult = await query(`
   170→        SELECT
   171→          COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN m.completed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days' THEN m.id END) as exchanges_week,
   172→          COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN cm.joined_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days' THEN cm.user_id END) as new_members
   173→        FROM communities.communities c
   174→        LEFT JOIN requests.requests r ON r.community_id = c.id
   175→        LEFT JOIN requests.matches m ON m.request_id = r.id AND m.status = 'completed'
   176→        LEFT JOIN communities.members cm ON cm.community_id = c.id
   177→        WHERE c.id = $1
   178→      `, [community.id]);
   179→
   180→      // Get recent helpers
   181→      const helpersResult = await query(`
   182→        SELECT u.name, COUNT(*) as help_count
   183→        FROM requests.matches m
   184→        JOIN requests.requests r ON m.request_id = r.id
   185→        JOIN auth.users u ON m.helper_id = u.id
   186→        WHERE r.community_id = $1
   187→          AND m.status = 'completed'
   188→          AND m.completed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
   189→        GROUP BY u.id, u.name
   190→        ORDER BY help_count DESC
   191→        LIMIT 3
   192→      `, [community.id]);
   193→
   194→      // Get open requests count
   195→      const openRequestsResult = await query(`
   196→        SELECT COUNT(*) as count
   197→        FROM requests.requests r
   198→        WHERE r.community_id = $1
   199→          AND r.status = 'open'
   200→          AND NOT EXISTS (
   201→            SELECT 1 FROM requests.matches m
   202→            WHERE m.request_id = r.id AND m.status IN ('accepted', 'completed')
   203→          )
   204→      `, [community.id]);
   205→
   206→      const stats = statsResult.rows[0];
   207→      const activityData: CommunityActivity = {
   208→        community_id: community.id,
   209→        community_name: community.name,
   210→        exchanges_completed_week: parseInt(stats?.exchanges_week || '0'),
   211→        recent_helpers: helpersResult.rows.map((row: any) => ({
   212→          name: row.name,
   213→          help_count: parseInt(row.help_count)
   214→        })),
   215→        open_requests_count: parseInt(openRequestsResult.rows[0]?.count || '0'),
   216→        new_members_count: parseInt(stats?.new_members || '0')
   217→      };
   218→
   219→      // Add community activity item
   220→      const itemId = `community_activity_${community.id}`;
   221→      if (!dismissed.has(itemId)) {
   222→        items.push({
   223→          id: itemId,
   224→          type: 'community_activity',
   225→          priority: 100,
   226→          created_at: new Date(),
   227→          data: activityData
   228→        });
   229→      }
   230→
   231→      // Add open requests if enabled
   232→      if (preferences.show_open_requests && activityData.open_requests_count > 0) {
   233→        const openRequests = await this.getOpenRequestsForCommunity(community.id, 2);
   234→        for (const request of openRequests) {
   235→          const requestItemId = `open_request_${request.request_id}`;
   236→          if (!dismissed.has(requestItemId)) {
   237→            items.push({
   238→              id: requestItemId,
   239→              type: 'open_request',
   240→              priority: this.calculateRequestPriority(request),
   241→              created_at: request.created_at,
   242→              data: request
   243→            });
   244→          }
   245→        }
   246→      }
   247→
   248→      if (items.length >= limit) break;
   249→    }
   250→
   251→    return items.slice(0, limit);
   252→  }
   253→
   254→  /**
   255→   * Get open requests for a community
   256→   */
   257→  private async getOpenRequestsForCommunity(communityId: string, limit: number): Promise<OpenRequest[]> {
   258→    const result = await query(`
   259→      SELECT
   260→        r.id as request_id,
   261→        r.title,
   262→        r.description,
   263→        r.user_id as author_id,
   264→        u.name as author_name,
   265→        r.community_id,
   266→        c.name as community_name,
   267→        r.urgency,
   268→        r.expected_duration,
   269→        r.created_at,
   270→        r.required_skills,
   271→        COUNT(DISTINCT m.id) as offers_count
   272→      FROM requests.requests r
   273→      JOIN auth.users u ON r.user_id = u.id
   274→      JOIN communities.communities c ON r.community_id = c.id
   275→      LEFT JOIN requests.matches m ON r.id = m.request_id AND m.status = 'proposed'
   276→      WHERE r.community_id = $1
   277→        AND r.status = 'open'
   278→        AND NOT EXISTS (
   279→          SELECT 1 FROM requests.matches m2
   280→          WHERE m2.request_id = r.id AND m2.status IN ('accepted', 'completed')
   281→        )
   282→      GROUP BY r.id, u.name, c.name
   283→      ORDER BY
   284→        CASE r.urgency
   285→          WHEN 'urgent' THEN 1
   286→          WHEN 'high' THEN 2
   287→          WHEN 'medium' THEN 3
   288→          ELSE 4
   289→        END,
   290→        r.created_at DESC
   291→      LIMIT $2
   292→    `, [communityId, limit]);
   293→
   294→    return result.rows.map((row: any) => ({
   295→      request_id: row.request_id,
   296→      title: row.title,
   297→      description: row.description,
   298→      author_id: row.author_id,
   299→      author_name: row.author_name,
   300→      community_id: row.community_id,
   301→      community_name: row.community_name,
   302→      urgency: row.urgency,
   303→      expected_duration: row.expected_duration,
   304→      created_at: row.created_at,
   305→      offers_count: parseInt(row.offers_count || '0'),
   306→      required_skills: row.required_skills || []
   307→    }));
   308→  }
   309→
   310→  /**
   311→   * Get suggested request items from adjacent communities
   312→   */
   313→  private async getSuggestedRequestItems(
   314→    userId: string,
   315→    limit: number,
   316→    preferences: any,
   317→    dismissed: Set<string>
   318→  ): Promise<FeedItem[]> {
   319→    const items: FeedItem[] = [];
   320→    const userBehavior = await this.getUserBehavior(userId);
   321→
   322→    // Get adjacent communities
   323→    const adjacentCommunities = await this.findAdjacentCommunities(userId, preferences.exploration_level);
   324→
   325→    for (const adjCommunity of adjacentCommunities) {
   326→      // Get open requests from this adjacent community
   327→      const requests = await query(`
   328→        SELECT
   329→          r.id as request_id,
   330→          r.title,
   331→          r.description,
   332→          r.community_id,
   333→          c.name as community_name,
   334→          r.urgency,
   335→          r.required_skills,
   336→          COUNT(DISTINCT m.id) as offers_count
   337→        FROM requests.requests r
   338→        JOIN communities.communities c ON r.community_id = c.id
   339→        LEFT JOIN requests.matches m ON r.id = m.request_id AND m.status = 'proposed'
   340→        WHERE r.community_id = $1
   341→          AND r.status = 'open'
   342→          AND r.user_id != $2
   343→          AND NOT EXISTS (
   344→            SELECT 1 FROM requests.matches m2
   345→            WHERE m2.request_id = r.id AND m2.status IN ('accepted', 'completed')
   346→          )
   347→        GROUP BY r.id, c.name
   348→        HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT m.id) < 3
   349→        ORDER BY r.created_at DESC
   350→        LIMIT 2
   351→      `, [adjCommunity.community_id, userId]);
   352→
   353→      for (const row of requests.rows) {
   354→        const matchScore = this.calculateSkillMatchScore(
   355→          row.required_skills || [],
   356→          userBehavior.skills
   357→        );
   358→
   359→        const reason = this.generateSuggestionReason(adjCommunity, userBehavior, matchScore);
   360→
   361→        const suggestedRequest: SuggestedRequest = {
   362→          request_id: row.request_id,
   363→          title: row.title,
   364→          description: row.description,
   365→          community_id: row.community_id,
   366→          community_name: row.community_name,
   367→          urgency: row.urgency,
   368→          reason: reason,
   369→          match_score: matchScore,
   370→          required_skills: row.required_skills || []
   371→        };
   372→
   373→        const itemId = `suggested_request_${row.request_id}`;
   374→        if (!dismissed.has(itemId)) {
   375→          items.push({
   376→            id: itemId,
   377→            type: 'suggested_request',
   378→            priority: 50 + matchScore,
   379→            created_at: new Date(),
   380→            data: suggestedRequest
   381→          });
   382→        }
   383→
   384→        if (items.length >= limit) break;
   385→      }
   386→
   387→      if (items.length >= limit) break;
   388→    }
   389→
   390→    return items.slice(0, limit);
   391→  }
   392→
   393→  /**
   394→   * Find adjacent communities
   395→   */
   396→  private async findAdjacentCommunities(
   397→    userId: string,
   398→    explorationLevel: 'conservative' | 'balanced' | 'adventurous'
   399→  ): Promise<Array<{ community_id: number; community_name: string; relevance_score: number }>> {
   400→    const multiplier = explorationLevel === 'adventurous' ? 1.5 :
   401→                       explorationLevel === 'conservative' ? 0.5 : 1.0;
   402→
   403→    // Get communities user is NOT part of
   404→    const result = await query(`
   405→      WITH user_communities AS (
   406→        SELECT community_id FROM communities.members WHERE user_id = $1
   407→      ),
   408→      adjacent_scores AS (
   409→        SELECT
   410→          c.id as community_id,
   411→          c.name as community_name,
   412→          (
   413→            -- Shared members score
   414→            (SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT m2.user_id)
   415→             FROM communities.members m2
   416→             WHERE m2.community_id = c.id
   417→               AND m2.user_id IN (
   418→                 SELECT user_id FROM communities.members
   419→                 WHERE community_id IN (SELECT community_id FROM user_communities)
   420→               )
   421→            ) * 2 +
   422→            -- Skill overlap score (would need skill tags on communities)
   423→            5
   424→          ) * $2 as relevance_score
   425→        FROM communities.communities c
   426→        WHERE c.id NOT IN (SELECT community_id FROM user_communities)
   427→      )
   428→      SELECT community_id, community_name, relevance_score
   429→      FROM adjacent_scores
   430→      WHERE relevance_score > 0
   431→      ORDER BY relevance_score DESC
   432→      LIMIT 5
   433→    `, [userId, multiplier]);
   434→
   435→    return result.rows;
   436→  }
   437→
   438→  /**
   439→   * Calculate skill match score
   440→   */
   441→  private calculateSkillMatchScore(requiredSkills: string[], userSkills: string[]): number {
   442→    if (requiredSkills.length === 0) return 50;
   443→
   444→    const matchingSkills = requiredSkills.filter(skill =>
   445→      userSkills.some(userSkill =>
   446→        userSkill.toLowerCase().includes(skill.toLowerCase()) ||
   447→        skill.toLowerCase().includes(userSkill.toLowerCase())
   448→      )
   449→    );
   450→
   451→    return Math.round((matchingSkills.length / requiredSkills.length) * 100);
   452→  }
   453→
   454→  /**
   455→   * Generate suggestion reason text
   456→   */
   457→  private generateSuggestionReason(
   458→    adjCommunity: any,
   459→    userBehavior: UserBehavior,
   460→    matchScore: number
   461→  ): string {
   462→    const reasons: string[] = [];
   463→
   464→    if (matchScore > 70) {
   465→      reasons.push(`Strong skill match (${matchScore}%)`);
   466→    } else if (matchScore > 40) {
   467→      reasons.push(`Good skill match (${matchScore}%)`);
   468→    }
   469→
   470→    reasons.push(`Members from your communities are also in ${adjCommunity.community_name}`);
   471→
   472→    return reasons.join('. ');
   473→  }
   474→
   475→  /**
   476→   * Get broader story items
   477→   */
   478→  private async getBroaderStoryItems(
   479→    userId: string,
   480→    limit: number,
   481→    dismissed: Set<string>
   482→  ): Promise<FeedItem[]> {
   483→    const items: FeedItem[] = [];
   484→
   485→    // Get first-time helpers (last 7 days)
   486→    const firstTimers = await query(`
   487→      SELECT
   488→        u.name as helper_name,
   489→        c.name as community_name,
   490→        c.id as community_id,
   491→        m.completed_at
   492→      FROM requests.matches m
   493→      JOIN auth.users u ON m.helper_id = u.id
   494→      JOIN requests.requests r ON m.request_id = r.id
   495→      JOIN communities.communities c ON r.community_id = c.id
   496→      WHERE m.status = 'completed'
   497→        AND m.completed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
   498→        AND m.helper_id != $1
   499→        AND (
   500→          SELECT COUNT(*) FROM requests.matches m2
   501→          WHERE m2.helper_id = m.helper_id AND m2.status = 'completed'
   502→        ) = 1
   503→      ORDER BY m.completed_at DESC
   504→      LIMIT 2
   505→    `, [userId]);
   506→
   507→    for (const row of firstTimers.rows) {
   508→      const story: Story = {
   509→        story_id: `first_timer_${row.helper_name}_${row.completed_at}`,
   510→        type: 'first_timer',
   511→        title: 'First-time helper!',
   512→        description: `${row.helper_name} completed their first help in "${row.community_name}"`,
   513→        community_id: row.community_id,
   514→        community_name: row.community_name,
   515→        created_at: row.completed_at
   516→      };
   517→
   518→      if (!dismissed.has(story.story_id)) {
   519→        items.push({
   520→          id: story.story_id,
   521→          type: 'story',
   522→          priority: 30,
   523→          created_at: story.created_at,
   524→          data: story
   525→        });
   526→      }
   527→    }
   528→
   529→    // Get milestone achievements
   530→    const milestones = await query(`
   531→      SELECT
   532→        u.name as helper_name,
   533→        COUNT(*) as help_count,
   534→        MAX(m.completed_at) as latest_help
   535→      FROM requests.matches m
   536→      JOIN auth.users u ON m.helper_id = u.id
   537→      WHERE m.status = 'completed'
   538→        AND m.helper_id != $1
   539→        AND m.completed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
   540→      GROUP BY u.id, u.name
   541→      HAVING COUNT(*) IN (10, 50, 100)
   542→      ORDER BY latest_help DESC
   543→      LIMIT 2
   544→    `, [userId]);
   545→
   546→    for (const row of milestones.rows) {
   547→      const story: Story = {
   548→        story_id: `milestone_${row.helper_name}_${row.help_count}`,
   549→        type: 'milestone',
   550→        title: `${row.help_count} helps milestone!`,
   551→        description: `${row.helper_name} just completed their ${row.help_count}th help!`,
   552→        created_at: row.latest_help
   553→      };
   554→
   555→      if (!dismissed.has(story.story_id)) {
   556→        items.push({
   557→          id: story.story_id,
   558→          type: 'story',
   559→          priority: 25,
   560→          created_at: story.created_at,
   561→          data: story
   562→        });
   563→      }
   564→    }
   565→
   566→    return items.slice(0, limit);
   567→  }
   568→
   569→  /**
   570→   * Calculate request priority
   571→   */
   572→  private calculateRequestPriority(request: OpenRequest): number {
   573→    let priority = 80; // Base priority
   574→
   575→    // Urgency boost
   576→    if (request.urgency === 'urgent') priority += 20;
   577→    else if (request.urgency === 'high') priority += 10;
   578→    else if (request.urgency === 'medium') priority += 5;
   579→
   580→    // Fewer offers = higher priority
   581→    if (request.offers_count === 0) priority += 15;
   582→    else if (request.offers_count === 1) priority += 5;
   583→
   584→    // Recent requests get priority
   585→    const ageHours = (Date.now() - request.created_at.getTime()) / (1000 * 60 * 60);
   586→    if (ageHours < 2) priority += 10;
   587→    else if (ageHours < 24) priority += 5;
   588→
   589→    return priority;
   590→  }
   591→
   592→  /**
   593→   * Get user preferences
   594→   */
   595→  private async getUserPreferences(userId: string): Promise<any> {
   596→    const result = await query(`
   597→      SELECT * FROM feed.preferences WHERE user_id = $1
   598→    `, [userId]);
   599→
   600→    if (result.rows.length === 0) {
   601→      // Return default preferences
   602→      return {
   603→        show_community_activity: true,
   604→        show_open_requests: true,
   605→        show_completed_exchanges: false,
   606→        suggest_adjacent_requests: true,
   607→        exploration_level: 'balanced',
   608→        show_explanations: true,
   609→        show_broader_stories: true,
   610→        allow_public_featuring: true
   611→      };
   612→    }
   613→
   614→    return result.rows[0];
   615→  }
   616→
   617→  /**
   618→   * Get dismissed items
   619→   */
   620→  private async getDismissedItems(userId: string): Promise<Set<string>> {
   621→    const result = await query(`
   622→      SELECT item_type || '_' || item_id as full_id
   623→      FROM feed.dismissed_items
   624→      WHERE user_id = $1
   625→        AND dismissed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
   626→    `, [userId]);
   627→
   628→    return new Set(result.rows.map((row: any) => row.full_id));
   629→  }
   630→}
   631→

  /**
   * Get user behavior metrics
   */
  private async getUserBehavior(userId: string): Promise<UserBehavior> {
    // Get recent helps count (last 30 days)
    const helpsResult = await query(`
      SELECT COUNT(*) as count
      FROM requests.matches m
      WHERE (m.helper_id = $1 OR m.helpee_id = $1)
        AND m.status = 'completed'
        AND m.completed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days'
    `, [userId]);

    // Get communities count
    const communitiesResult = await query(`
      SELECT COUNT(*) as count
      FROM communities.members
      WHERE user_id = $1
    `, [userId]);

    // Get user's skills (inferred from completed helps)
    const skillsResult = await query(`
      SELECT DISTINCT unnest(r.required_skills) as skill
      FROM requests.matches m
      JOIN requests.requests r ON m.request_id = r.id
      WHERE m.helper_id = $1 AND m.status = 'completed'
      LIMIT 10
    `, [userId]);

    // Get user registration date
    const userResult = await query(`
      SELECT created_at
      FROM auth.users
      WHERE id = $1
    `, [userId]);

    return {
      recent_helps_count: parseInt(helpsResult.rows[0]?.count || '0'),
      communities_count: parseInt(communitiesResult.rows[0]?.count || '0'),
      skills: skillsResult.rows.map((row: { skill: string }) => row.skill),
      member_since: userResult.rows[0]?.created_at || new Date()
    };
  }
+
  /**
   * Get user behavior metrics
   */
  private async getUserBehavior(userId: string): Promise<UserBehavior> {
    // Get recent helps count (last 30 days)
    // Note: responder_id is used in matches table, not helper_id
    const helpsResult = await query(`
      SELECT COUNT(*) as count
      FROM requests.matches m
      JOIN requests.help_requests r ON m.request_id = r.id
      WHERE (m.responder_id = $1 OR r.requester_id = $1)
        AND m.status = 'completed'
        AND m.completed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days'
    `, [userId]);

    // Get communities count
    const communitiesResult = await query(`
      SELECT COUNT(*) as count
      FROM communities.members
      WHERE user_id = $1
    `, [userId]);

    // Get user's skills (inferred from completed helps by category)
    // Note: help_requests uses 'category' not 'required_skills'
    const skillsResult = await query(`
      SELECT DISTINCT r.category as skill
      FROM requests.matches m
      JOIN requests.help_requests r ON m.request_id = r.id
      WHERE m.responder_id = $1 AND m.status = 'completed'
      LIMIT 10
    `, [userId]);

    // Get user registration date
    const userResult = await query(`
      SELECT created_at
      FROM auth.users
      WHERE id = $1
    `, [userId]);

    return {
      recent_helps_count: parseInt(helpsResult.rows[0]?.count || '0'),
      communities_count: parseInt(communitiesResult.rows[0]?.count || '0'),
      skills: skillsResult.rows.map((row: { skill: string }) => row.skill),
      member_since: userResult.rows[0]?.created_at || new Date()
    };
  }

          COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN m.completed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days' THEN m.id END) as exchanges_week,
          COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN cm.joined_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days' THEN cm.user_id END) as new_members

✏️ Edit c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\services\feed-service\src\services\feedComposer.ts

  /**
   * Get open requests for a community
   */
  private async getOpenRequestsForCommunity(communityId: string, limit: number): Promise<OpenRequest[]> {
    const result = await query(`
      SELECT
        r.id as request_id,
        r.title,
        r.description,
        r.user_id as author_id,
        u.name as author_name,
        r.community_id,
        c.name as community_name,
        r.urgency,
        r.expected_duration,
        r.created_at,
        r.required_skills,
        COUNT(DISTINCT m.id) as offers_count
      FROM requests.requests r
      JOIN auth.users u ON r.user_id = u.id
      JOIN communities.communities c ON r.community_id = c.id
      LEFT JOIN requests.matches m ON r.id = m.request_id AND m.status = 'proposed'
      WHERE r.community_id = $1
        AND r.status = 'open'
        AND NOT EXISTS (
          SELECT 1 FROM requests.matches m2
          WHERE m2.request_id = r.id AND m2.status IN ('accepted', 'completed')
        )
      GROUP BY r.id, u.name, c.name
      ORDER BY
        CASE r.urgency
          WHEN 'urgent' THEN 1
          WHEN 'high' THEN 2
          WHEN 'medium' THEN 3
          ELSE 4
        END,
        r.created_at DESC
      LIMIT $2
    `, [communityId, limit]);

    return result.rows.map((row: any) => ({
      request_id: row.request_id,
      title: row.title,
      description: row.description,
      author_id: row.author_id,
      author_name: row.author_name,
      community_id: row.community_id,
      community_name: row.community_name,
      urgency: row.urgency,
      expected_duration: row.expected_duration,
      created_at: row.created_at,
      offers_count: parseInt(row.offers_count || '0'),
      required_skills: row.required_skills || []
    }));
  }
+
  /**
   * Get open requests for a community
   */
  private async getOpenRequestsForCommunity(communityId: string, limit: number): Promise<OpenRequest[]> {
    // Note: Table is help_requests, column is requester_id, no required_skills column
    const result = await query(`
      SELECT
        r.id as request_id,
        r.title,
        r.description,
        r.requester_id as author_id,
        u.name as author_name,
        r.community_id,
        c.name as community_name,
        r.urgency,
        r.category,
        r.created_at,
        COUNT(DISTINCT m.id) as offers_count
      FROM requests.help_requests r
      JOIN auth.users u ON r.requester_id = u.id
      JOIN communities.communities c ON r.community_id = c.id
      LEFT JOIN requests.matches m ON r.id = m.request_id AND m.status = 'proposed'
      WHERE r.community_id = $1
        AND r.status = 'open'
        AND NOT EXISTS (
          SELECT 1 FROM requests.matches m2
          WHERE m2.request_id = r.id AND m2.status IN ('accepted', 'completed')
        )
      GROUP BY r.id, u.name, c.name
      ORDER BY
        CASE r.urgency
          WHEN 'urgent' THEN 1
          WHEN 'high' THEN 2
          WHEN 'medium' THEN 3
          ELSE 4
        END,
        r.created_at DESC
      LIMIT $2
    `, [communityId, limit]);

    return result.rows.map((row: any) => ({
      request_id: row.request_id,
      title: row.title,
      description: row.description,
      author_id: row.author_id,
      author_name: row.author_name,
      community_id: row.community_id,
      community_name: row.community_name,
      urgency: row.urgency,
      expected_duration: null, // Column doesn't exist, use null
      created_at: row.created_at,
      offers_count: parseInt(row.offers_count || '0'),
      required_skills: row.category ? [row.category] : [] // Use category as skill proxy
    }));
  }

   293→          WHEN 'medium' THEN 3

    for (const adjCommunity of adjacentCommunities) {
      // Get open requests from this adjacent community
      const requests = await query(`
        SELECT
          r.id as request_id,
          r.title,
          r.description,
          r.community_id,
          c.name as community_name,
          r.urgency,
          r.required_skills,
          COUNT(DISTINCT m.id) as offers_count
        FROM requests.requests r
        JOIN communities.communities c ON r.community_id = c.id
        LEFT JOIN requests.matches m ON r.id = m.request_id AND m.status = 'proposed'
        WHERE r.community_id = $1
          AND r.status = 'open'

          AND NOT EXISTS (
            SELECT 1 FROM requests.matches m2
            WHERE m2.request_id = r.id AND m2.status IN ('accepted', 'completed')
          )
        GROUP BY r.id, c.name
        HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT m.id) < 3
        ORDER BY r.created_at DESC
        LIMIT 2
      `, [adjCommunity.community_id, userId]);

          row.required_skills || [],
          userBehavior.skills
        );

  /**
   * Get broader story items
   */
  private async getBroaderStoryItems(
    userId: string,
    limit: number,
    dismissed: Set<string>
  ): Promise<FeedItem[]> {
    const items: FeedItem[] = [];

    // Get first-time helpers (last 7 days)
    const firstTimers = await query(`
      SELECT
        u.name as helper_name,
        c.name as community_name,
        c.id as community_id,
        m.completed_at
      FROM requests.matches m
      JOIN auth.users u ON m.helper_id = u.id
      JOIN requests.requests r ON m.request_id = r.id
      JOIN communities.communities c ON r.community_id = c.id
      WHERE m.status = 'completed'
        AND m.completed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
        AND m.helper_id != $1
        AND (
          SELECT COUNT(*) FROM requests.matches m2
          WHERE m2.helper_id = m.helper_id AND m2.status = 'completed'
        ) = 1
      ORDER BY m.completed_at DESC
      LIMIT 2
    `, [userId]);
+
  /**
   * Get broader story items
   */
  private async getBroaderStoryItems(
    userId: string,
    limit: number,
    dismissed: Set<string>
  ): Promise<FeedItem[]> {
    const items: FeedItem[] = [];

    // Get first-time helpers (last 7 days)
    // Note: Column is responder_id, table is help_requests
    const firstTimers = await query(`
      SELECT
        u.name as helper_name,
        c.name as community_name,
        c.id as community_id,
        m.completed_at
      FROM requests.matches m
      JOIN auth.users u ON m.responder_id = u.id
      JOIN requests.help_requests r ON m.request_id = r.id
      JOIN communities.communities c ON r.community_id = c.id
      WHERE m.status = 'completed'
        AND m.completed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
        AND m.responder_id != $1
        AND (
          SELECT COUNT(*) FROM requests.matches m2
          WHERE m2.responder_id = m.responder_id AND m2.status = 'completed'
        ) = 1
      ORDER BY m.completed_at DESC
      LIMIT 2
    `, [userId]);

      SELECT
        u.name as helper_name,
        COUNT(*) as help_count,
        MAX(m.completed_at) as latest_help
      FROM requests.matches m
      JOIN auth.users u ON m.helper_id = u.id
      WHERE m.status = 'completed'
        AND m.helper_id != $1
        AND m.completed_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'

Assistant2025-11-22T21:11:47.640Z
