Tool reply2025-11-23T00:02:35.654Z
     1→import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
     2→import { useRouter } from 'next/router'
     3→import Head from 'next/head'
     4→import Link from 'next/link'
     5→import { communityService } from '@/lib/api'
     6→import Layout from '@/components/Layout'
     7→
     8→interface Member {
     9→  id: string
    10→  user_id: string
    11→  user_name: string
    12→  user_email: string
    13→  role: string
    14→  status: string
    15→  joined_at: string
    16→  invited_by_name?: string
    17→}
    18→
    19→interface Norm {
    20→  id: string
    21→  description: string
    22→  rationale: string
    23→  status: string
    24→  creator_name: string
    25→  approval_count: number
    26→  created_at: string
    27→}
    28→
    29→interface Community {
    30→  id: string
    31→  name: string
    32→  description: string
    33→  current_members: number
    34→  max_members: number
    35→  access_type: 'public' | 'private'
    36→  creator_id: string
    37→  creator_name: string
    38→  status: string
    39→  members: Member[]
    40→}
    41→
    42→export default function CommunityDetailPage() {
    43→  const router = useRouter()
    44→  const { id } = router.query
    45→  const [community, setCommunity] = useState<Community | null>(null)
    46→  const [norms, setNorms] = useState<Norm[]>([])
    47→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
    48→  const [error, setError] = useState('')
    49→  const [currentUser, setCurrentUser] = useState<any>(null)
    50→  const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState<'overview' | 'members' | 'norms'>('overview')
    51→  const [newNorm, setNewNorm] = useState({ description: '', rationale: '' })
    52→  const [showNormForm, setShowNormForm] = useState(false)
    53→  const [showInviteModal, setShowInviteModal] = useState(false)
    54→  const [inviteEmail, setInviteEmail] = useState('')
    55→  const [joiningCommunity, setJoiningCommunity] = useState(false)
    56→
    57→  useEffect(() => {
    58→    const token = localStorage.getItem('token')
    59→    const userData = localStorage.getItem('user')
    60→    if (!token) {
    61→      router.push('/login')
    62→      return
    63→    }
    64→    if (userData) {
    65→      setCurrentUser(JSON.parse(userData))
    66→    }
    67→  }, [router])
    68→
    69→  useEffect(() => {
    70→    if (id) {
    71→      fetchCommunity()
    72→      fetchNorms()
    73→    }
    74→  }, [id])
    75→
    76→  const fetchCommunity = async () => {
    77→    try {
    78→      setLoading(true)
    79→      const response = await communityService.getCommunity(id as string)
    80→      setCommunity(response.data.data)
    81→    } catch (err: any) {
    82→      setError(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to load community')
    83→    } finally {
    84→      setLoading(false)
    85→    }
    86→  }
    87→
    88→  const fetchNorms = async () => {
    89→    try {
    90→      const response = await communityService.getNorms(id as string)
    91→      setNorms(response.data.data)
    92→    } catch (err: any) {
    93→      console.error('Failed to load norms:', err)
    94→    }
    95→  }
    96→
    97→  const handleCreateNorm = async (e: React.FormEvent) => {
    98→    e.preventDefault()
    99→    if (!currentUser || !newNorm.description) return
   100→
   101→    try {
   102→      await communityService.createNorm(id as string, {
   103→        description: newNorm.description,
   104→        rationale: newNorm.rationale,
   105→        created_by: currentUser.id,
   106→      })
   107→      setNewNorm({ description: '', rationale: '' })
   108→      setShowNormForm(false)
   109→      fetchNorms()
   110→    } catch (err: any) {
   111→      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to create norm')
   112→    }
   113→  }
   114→
   115→  const handleApproveNorm = async (normId: string) => {
   116→    if (!currentUser) return
   117→    try {
   118→      await communityService.approveNorm(id as string, normId, currentUser.id)
   119→      fetchNorms()
   120→    } catch (err: any) {
   121→      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to approve norm')
   122→    }
   123→  }
   124→
   125→  const handleJoinCommunity = async () => {
   126→    if (!currentUser || !id || !community) return
   127→
   128→    setJoiningCommunity(true)
   129→    try {
   130→      await communityService.joinCommunity(id as string, {
   131→        user_id: currentUser.id
   132→      })
   133→      // Refresh community data to show updated member list
   134→      await fetchCommunity()
   135→
   136→      if (community.access_type === 'public') {
   137→        alert('Successfully joined the community!')
   138→      } else {
   139→        alert('Join request submitted! Waiting for admin approval.')
   140→      }
   141→    } catch (err: any) {
   142→      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to join community')
   143→    } finally {
   144→      setJoiningCommunity(false)
   145→    }
   146→  }
   147→
   148→  const handleInviteMember = async (e: React.FormEvent) => {
   149→    e.preventDefault()
   150→    if (!currentUser || !id || !inviteEmail) return
   151→
   152→    try {
   153→      // In a real app, you'd look up the user by email first
   154→      // For now, this is a placeholder - you'd need a user lookup endpoint
   155→      alert(`Invitation feature coming soon! Would invite: ${inviteEmail}`)
   156→      setShowInviteModal(false)
   157→      setInviteEmail('')
   158→    } catch (err: any) {
   159→      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to send invitation')
   160→    }
   161→  }
   162→
   163→  const membershipRecord = community?.members.find((m: Member) => m.user_id === currentUser?.id)
   164→  const isMember = membershipRecord?.status === 'active'
   165→  const isPending = membershipRecord?.status === 'pending'
   166→  const isAdmin = membershipRecord?.role === 'admin' && membershipRecord?.status === 'active'
   167→
   168→  if (loading) {
   169→    return (
   170→      <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center">
   171→        <div className="text-gray-500">Loading...</div>
   172→      </div>
   173→    )
   174→  }
   175→
   176→  if (error || !community) {
   177→    return (
   178→      <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center">
   179→        <div className="text-red-500">{error || 'Community not found'}</div>
   180→      </div>
   181→    )
   182→  }
   183→
   184→  return (
   185→    <>
   186→      <Head>
   187→        <title>{community.name} - Karmyq</title>
   188→      </Head>
   189→      <Layout title={community.name}>
   190→        <div className="container mx-auto px-4 py-8">
   191→          {/* Community Header */}
   192→          <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-md p-8 mb-6">
   193→            <div className="flex justify-between items-start mb-4">
   194→              <div>
   195→                <p className="text-gray-600">{community.description}</p>
   196→              </div>
   197→              {!isMember && !isPending && (
   198→                <button
   199→                  onClick={handleJoinCommunity}
   200→                  disabled={joiningCommunity || community.current_members >= community.max_members}
   201→                  className={`px-6 py-2 rounded disabled:cursor-not-allowed ${
   202→                    joiningCommunity || community.current_members >= community.max_members
   203→                      ? 'bg-gray-400 text-white'
   204→                      : community.access_type === 'private'
   205→                      ? 'bg-purple-600 text-white hover:bg-purple-700'
   206→                      : 'bg-blue-600 text-white hover:bg-blue-700'
   207→                  }`}
   208→                >
   209→                  {joiningCommunity
   210→                    ? 'Joining...'
   211→                    : community.current_members >= community.max_members
   212→                    ? 'Community Full'
   213→                    : community.access_type === 'private'
   214→                    ? 'Request to Join'
   215→                    : 'Join Community'}
   216→                </button>
   217→              )}
   218→              {isPending && (
   219→                <div className="px-6 py-2 bg-yellow-100 text-yellow-800 rounded font-medium">
   220→                  ⏳ Join Request Pending
   221→                </div>
   222→              )}
   223→            </div>
   224→            <div className="flex items-center gap-6 text-sm text-gray-600">
   225→              <span>Created by {community.creator_name}</span>
   226→              <span>•</span>
   227→              <span>
   228→                {community.current_members} / {community.max_members} members
   229→              </span>
   230→            </div>
   231→            <div className="mt-4">
   232→              <div className="w-full bg-gray-200 rounded-full h-2">
   233→                <div
   234→                  className="bg-blue-600 h-2 rounded-full"
   235→                  style={{
   236→                    width: `${(community.current_members / community.max_members) * 100}%`,
   237→                  }}
   238→                ></div>
   239→              </div>
   240→            </div>
   241→          </div>
   242→
   243→          {/* Tabs */}
   244→          <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-md mb-6">
   245→            <div className="border-b border-gray-200">
   246→              <nav className="flex">
   247→                <button
   248→                  onClick={() => setActiveTab('overview')}
   249→                  className={`px-6 py-4 font-medium ${
   250→                    activeTab === 'overview'
   251→                      ? 'border-b-2 border-blue-600 text-blue-600'
   252→                      : 'text-gray-600 hover:text-gray-800'
   253→                  }`}
   254→                >
   255→                  Overview
   256→                </button>
   257→                <button
   258→                  onClick={() => setActiveTab('members')}
   259→                  className={`px-6 py-4 font-medium ${
   260→                    activeTab === 'members'
   261→                      ? 'border-b-2 border-blue-600 text-blue-600'
   262→                      : 'text-gray-600 hover:text-gray-800'
   263→                  }`}
   264→                >
   265→                  Members ({community.members.length})
   266→                </button>
   267→                <button
   268→                  onClick={() => setActiveTab('norms')}
   269→                  className={`px-6 py-4 font-medium ${
   270→                    activeTab === 'norms'
   271→                      ? 'border-b-2 border-blue-600 text-blue-600'
   272→                      : 'text-gray-600 hover:text-gray-800'
   273→                  }`}
   274→                >
   275→                  Norms ({norms.length})
   276→                </button>
   277→              </nav>
   278→            </div>
   279→
   280→            <div className="p-6">
   281→              {/* Overview Tab */}
   282→              {activeTab === 'overview' && (
   283→                <div>
   284→                  <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-4">About this Community</h3>
   285→                  <p className="text-gray-600 mb-6">
   286→                    {community.description || 'No description provided.'}
   287→                  </p>
   288→                  <div className="grid md:grid-cols-3 gap-4">
   289→                    <div className="bg-blue-50 rounded-lg p-4">
   290→                      <div className="text-3xl font-bold text-blue-600">
   291→                        {community.current_members}
   292→                      </div>
   293→                      <div className="text-sm text-gray-600">Active Members</div>
   294→                    </div>
   295→                    <div className="bg-green-50 rounded-lg p-4">
   296→                      <div className="text-3xl font-bold text-green-600">{norms.filter(n => n.status === 'active').length}</div>
   297→                      <div className="text-sm text-gray-600">Active Norms</div>
   298→                    </div>
   299→                    <div className="bg-purple-50 rounded-lg p-4">
   300→                      <div className="text-3xl font-bold text-purple-600">0</div>
   301→                      <div className="text-sm text-gray-600">Active Requests</div>
   302→                    </div>
   303→                  </div>
   304→                </div>
   305→              )}
   306→
   307→              {/* Members Tab */}
   308→              {activeTab === 'members' && (
   309→                <div>
   310→                  <div className="flex justify-between items-center mb-4">
   311→                    <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold">Members</h3>
   312→                    {isAdmin && (
   313→                      <button
   314→                        onClick={() => setShowInviteModal(true)}
   315→                        className="px-4 py-2 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded hover:bg-blue-700"
   316→                      >
   317→                        Invite Member
   318→                      </button>
   319→                    )}
   320→                  </div>
   321→                  <div className="space-y-3">
   322→                    {community.members.map((member) => (
   323→                      <div
   324→                        key={member.id}
   325→                        className="flex items-center justify-between p-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg"
   326→                      >
   327→                        <div>
   328→                          <div className="font-semibold">{member.user_name}</div>
   329→                          <div className="text-sm text-gray-600">{member.user_email}</div>
   330→                          {member.invited_by_name && (
   331→                            <div className="text-xs text-gray-500">
   332→                              Invited by {member.invited_by_name}
   333→                            </div>
   334→                          )}
   335→                        </div>
   336→                        <div className="flex items-center gap-3">
   337→                          <span
   338→                            className={`px-3 py-1 rounded text-sm font-medium ${
   339→                              member.role === 'admin'
   340→                                ? 'bg-purple-100 text-purple-800'
   341→                                : 'bg-gray-200 text-gray-700'
   342→                            }`}
   343→                          >
   344→                            {member.role}
   345→                          </span>
   346→                          <span className="text-xs text-gray-500">
   347→                            {new Date(member.joined_at).toLocaleDateString()}
   348→                          </span>
   349→                        </div>
   350→                      </div>
   351→                    ))}
   352→                  </div>
   353→                </div>
   354→              )}
   355→
   356→              {/* Norms Tab */}
   357→              {activeTab === 'norms' && (
   358→                <div>
   359→                  <div className="flex justify-between items-center mb-4">
   360→                    <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold">Community Norms</h3>
   361→                    {isMember && !showNormForm && (
   362→                      <button
   363→                        onClick={() => setShowNormForm(true)}
   364→                        className="px-4 py-2 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded hover:bg-blue-700"
   365→                      >
   366→                        Propose Norm
   367→                      </button>
   368→                    )}
   369→                  </div>
   370→
   371→                  {showNormForm && (
   372→                    <form onSubmit={handleCreateNorm} className="bg-blue-50 p-4 rounded-lg mb-4">
   373→                      <h4 className="font-semibold mb-3">Propose New Norm</h4>
   374→                      <input
   375→                        type="text"
   376→                        placeholder="Norm description"
   377→                        value={newNorm.description}
   378→                        onChange={(e) => setNewNorm({ ...newNorm, description: e.target.value })}
   379→                        className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded mb-2"
   380→                        required
   381→                      />
   382→                      <textarea
   383→                        placeholder="Rationale (optional)"
   384→                        value={newNorm.rationale}
   385→                        onChange={(e) => setNewNorm({ ...newNorm, rationale: e.target.value })}
   386→                        className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded mb-2"
   387→                        rows={2}
   388→                      />
   389→                      <div className="flex gap-2">
   390→                        <button
   391→                          type="submit"
   392→                          className="px-4 py-2 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded hover:bg-blue-700"
   393→                        >
   394→                          Submit
   395→                        </button>
   396→                        <button
   397→                          type="button"
   398→                          onClick={() => setShowNormForm(false)}
   399→                          className="px-4 py-2 bg-gray-200 text-gray-700 rounded hover:bg-gray-300"
   400→                        >
   401→                          Cancel
   402→                        </button>
   403→                      </div>
   404→                    </form>
   405→                  )}
   406→
   407→                  <div className="space-y-3">
   408→                    {norms.length === 0 ? (
   409→                      <p className="text-gray-500">No norms yet. Members can propose norms to establish community guidelines.</p>
   410→                    ) : (
   411→                      norms.map((norm) => (
   412→                        <div key={norm.id} className="p-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg">
   413→                          <div className="flex items-start justify-between mb-2">
   414→                            <div className="flex-1">
   415→                              <p className="font-medium">{norm.description}</p>
   416→                              {norm.rationale && (
   417→                                <p className="text-sm text-gray-600 mt-1">{norm.rationale}</p>
   418→                              )}
   419→                              <p className="text-xs text-gray-500 mt-2">
   420→                                Proposed by {norm.creator_name}
   421→                              </p>
   422→                            </div>
   423→                            <span
   424→                              className={`px-3 py-1 rounded text-sm font-medium ${
   425→                                norm.status === 'active'
   426→                                  ? 'bg-green-100 text-green-800'
   427→                                  : 'bg-yellow-100 text-yellow-800'
   428→                              }`}
   429→                            >
   430→                              {norm.status}
   431→                            </span>
   432→                          </div>
   433→                          <div className="flex items-center justify-between mt-3">
   434→                            <span className="text-sm text-gray-600">
   435→                              {norm.approval_count} approval{norm.approval_count !== 1 ? 's' : ''}
   436→                            </span>
   437→                            {isMember && norm.status === 'proposed' && (
   438→                              <button
   439→                                onClick={() => handleApproveNorm(norm.id)}
   440→                                className="px-3 py-1 bg-blue-600 text-white text-sm rounded hover:bg-blue-700"
   441→                              >
   442→                                Approve
   443→                              </button>
   444→                            )}
   445→                          </div>
   446→                        </div>
   447→                      ))
   448→                    )}
   449→                  </div>
   450→                </div>
   451→              )}
   452→            </div>
   453→          </div>
   454→        </div>
   455→
   456→        {/* Invite Member Modal */}
   457→        {showInviteModal && (
   458→          <div className="fixed inset-0 bg-black bg-opacity-50 flex items-center justify-center z-50">
   459→            <div className="bg-white rounded-lg p-8 max-w-md w-full mx-4">
   460→              <h3 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-4">Invite Member</h3>
   461→              <form onSubmit={handleInviteMember}>
   462→                <div className="mb-4">
   463→                  <label htmlFor="inviteEmail" className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-2">
   464→                    User Email
   465→                  </label>
   466→                  <input
   467→                    type="email"
   468→                    id="inviteEmail"
   469→                    value={inviteEmail}
   470→                    onChange={(e) => setInviteEmail(e.target.value)}
   471→                    className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-transparent"
   472→                    placeholder="user@example.com"
   473→                    required
   474→                  />
   475→                  <p className="mt-2 text-sm text-gray-500">
   476→                    Enter the email address of the person you want to invite. They must have an account.
   477→                  </p>
   478→                </div>
   479→                <div className="flex gap-3">
   480→                  <button
   481→                    type="submit"
   482→                    className="flex-1 px-4 py-2 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded hover:bg-blue-700"
   483→                  >
   484→                    Send Invitation
   485→                  </button>
   486→                  <button
   487→                    type="button"
   488→                    onClick={() => {
   489→                      setShowInviteModal(false)
   490→                      setInviteEmail('')
   491→                    }}
   492→                    className="px-4 py-2 bg-gray-200 text-gray-700 rounded hover:bg-gray-300"
   493→                  >
   494→                    Cancel
   495→                  </button>
   496→                </div>
   497→              </form>
   498→            </div>
   499→          </div>
   500→        )}
   501→      </Layout>
   502→    </>
   503→  )
   504→}
   505→

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

Assistant2025-11-23T00:03:34.019Z
📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\claude.md
c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\claude.md
# Karmyq - Mutual Aid Platform

## Project Overview
Karmyq is a multi-tenant SaaS mutual aid platform where community members help each other. Version 5.1.0 with ephemeral data and reputation decay features.

## Architecture
- **Microservices**: 8 backend services communicating via REST and Redis queues
- **Multi-Tenant**: Row-Level Security (RLS) with community_id isolation
- **Event-Driven**: Bull/Redis queues for async processing (karmyq-events)

## Tech Stack
- **Backend**: Node.js/Express/TypeScript (all services)
- **Frontend**: Next.js 14 with Tailwind CSS
- **Mobile**: React Native + Expo
- **Database**: PostgreSQL 15 with schemas (auth, community, requests, reputation, notifications, messaging)
- **Cache/Queue**: Redis + Bull
- **Monorepo**: Turborepo

## Service Ports
| Service | Port | Schema |
|---------|------|--------|
| Frontend | 3000 | - |
| Auth | 3001 | auth |
| Community | 3002 | community |
| Request | 3003 | requests |
| Reputation | 3004 | reputation |
| Notification | 3005 | notifications |
| Messaging | 3006 | messaging |
| Feed | 3007 | - (reads all) |
| Cleanup | 3008 | - (writes all) |

## Key Patterns

### Authentication
- JWT tokens with `userId` and `communityMemberships` array
- Middleware chain: `authenticateToken` -> `extractCommunityContext` -> `requireRole`
- All requests require Bearer token in Authorization header

### Database Schema Conventions
- Tables use schema prefixes: `requests.help_requests`, `community.memberships`
- Foreign keys to users: `requester_id`, `responder_id` (not `user_id`, `helper_id`)
- All tables have `community_id` for RLS
- Timestamps: `created_at`, `updated_at`, `expires_at`

### API Response Format
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": { ... },
  "message": "Optional message"
}
```

## Development Commands
```bash
# Start all services
docker-compose up -d

# Run tests
cd tests && npm test

# Frontend dev
cd apps/frontend && npm run dev

# Single service logs
docker logs karmyq-auth-service -f
```

## Important Files
- `infrastructure/docker/docker-compose.yml` - Service orchestration
- `infrastructure/postgres/init.sql` - Database schema
- `packages/shared/` - Shared utilities, middleware, types
- `tests/` - Integration and E2E tests

## Current Status (v5.1.0)
- Multi-tenant SaaS with RLS
- Ephemeral data with configurable TTLs
- Reputation decay system
- Full test suite (integration, E2E, load)
Tool reply2025-11-23T00:03:39.536Z
File created successfully at: c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\claude.md
Assistant2025-11-23T00:03:51.382Z
📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\services\claude.md
c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\services\claude.md
# Services Directory

## Overview
All backend microservices. Each service is independent with its own Dockerfile, package.json, and entry point.

## Service Structure Pattern
```
service-name/
├── src/
│   ├── index.ts        # Express app entry
│   ├── routes/         # API routes
│   ├── services/       # Business logic
│   └── models/         # Data access (if needed)
├── Dockerfile
├── package.json
├── tsconfig.json
├── CONTEXT.md          # Service documentation
└── README.md
```

## Database Connections
All services connect to the same PostgreSQL instance but use schema-specific queries:
- Auth: `auth.users`, `auth.sessions`
- Community: `community.communities`, `community.memberships`, `community.norms`
- Request: `requests.help_requests`, `requests.offers`, `requests.matches`
- Reputation: `reputation.karma_records`, `reputation.trust_scores`
- Notification: `notifications.notifications`, `notifications.preferences`
- Messaging: `messaging.conversations`, `messaging.messages`

## Common Environment Variables
All services require:
- `PORT` - Service port
- `DATABASE_URL` - PostgreSQL connection string
- `JWT_SECRET` - For token verification
- `REDIS_URL` - Redis connection (services using queues)

## Event Queue
Services emit/consume events via Bull queue `karmyq-events`:
- `match_completed` -> Reputation, Notification services
- `karma_awarded` -> Notification service
- `new_request` -> Feed, Notification services

## Creating New Services
1. Copy `_template/` directory
2. Update package.json name and port
3. Add to docker-compose.yml
4. Add database schema if needed
5. Create CONTEXT.md with API docs
Tool reply2025-11-23T00:03:55.265Z
File created successfully at: c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\services\claude.md
Assistant2025-11-23T00:04:06.625Z
📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\claude.md
c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\claude.md
# Apps Directory

## Overview
Frontend applications for web and mobile platforms.

## Applications

### frontend/ (Port 3000)
Next.js 14 web application with:
- Pages Router (`src/pages/`)
- Tailwind CSS styling
- API client in `src/lib/api.ts`
- Layout components in `src/components/`

Key pages:
- `/` - Landing/Dashboard
- `/login`, `/register` - Authentication
- `/communities` - Community list
- `/communities/[id]` - Community detail
- `/communities/[id]/admin` - Admin settings (admins only)
- `/requests`, `/offers` - Help requests/offers

### mobile/
React Native + Expo application:
- Expo Router for navigation
- Redux Toolkit for state
- Services in `services/` for API calls
- Currently: Feed screen implemented, others pending

## Shared Code
Both apps import from `packages/shared/` for:
- Type definitions
- API response types
- Constants

## Development

### Frontend (Web)
```bash
cd apps/frontend
npm install
npm run dev  # http://localhost:3000
```

### Mobile
```bash
cd apps/mobile
npm install
npx expo start
# Press 'i' for iOS, 'a' for Android
```

## API Client Pattern
All API calls go through `src/lib/api.ts`:
```typescript
// Uses axios with baseURL and auth interceptor
const api = axios.create({
  baseURL: process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL || 'http://localhost:3001'
});

// Auth header automatically added from localStorage token
```
Tool reply2025-11-23T00:04:10.187Z
File created successfully at: c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\claude.md
Assistant2025-11-23T00:04:22.309Z
📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\infrastructure\claude.md
c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\infrastructure\claude.md
# Infrastructure Directory

## Overview
Docker configuration, database schemas, and observability setup.

## Key Files

### docker/
- `docker-compose.yml` - Main orchestration (all services + dependencies)
- `docker-compose.test.yml` - Test environment configuration

### postgres/
- `init.sql` - Complete database schema with all tables, indexes, and RLS policies
- `migrations/` - Incremental migration scripts

### Database Schemas
PostgreSQL uses separate schemas for isolation:
```sql
-- Schemas
auth        -- users, sessions
community   -- communities, memberships, norms, settings
requests    -- help_requests, offers, matches
reputation  -- karma_records, trust_scores, badges
notifications -- notifications, preferences
messaging   -- conversations, messages, participants
```

### Key Tables Reference
```sql
-- Users
auth.users (id, email, password_hash, name, created_at)
auth.sessions (id, user_id, token, expires_at)

-- Communities
community.communities (id, name, description, creator_id, settings)
community.memberships (id, community_id, user_id, role, status)
community.settings (community_id, request_ttl_days, karma_decay_enabled, etc.)

-- Requests
requests.help_requests (id, community_id, requester_id, title, category, status, expires_at)
requests.offers (id, community_id, offerer_id, title, skills, expires_at)
requests.matches (id, request_id, responder_id, status, completed_at)
```

## Observability Stack

### grafana/
Grafana dashboards and datasource provisioning

### prometheus/
- `prometheus.yml` - Metrics scraping config

### loki/
- `loki-config.yml` - Log aggregation config
- `promtail-config.yml` - Log shipping config

## Docker Commands
```bash
# Full stack
docker-compose up -d

# Rebuild specific service
docker-compose up -d --build auth-service

# View logs
docker-compose logs -f service-name

# Reset database
docker-compose down -v
docker-compose up -d
```
Tool reply2025-11-23T00:04:26.267Z
File created successfully at: c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\infrastructure\claude.md
Assistant2025-11-23T00:04:35.927Z
📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\packages\claude.md
c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\packages\claude.md
# Packages Directory

## Overview
Shared code used across services and apps via Turborepo workspaces.

## packages/shared/

### middleware/
Reusable Express middleware:
- `auth.ts` - `authenticateToken`, `extractCommunityContext`, `requireRole`
- `rateLimit.ts` - Rate limiting with Redis backend
- `validation.ts` - Request validation helpers

### types/
TypeScript interfaces:
- API response types
- Entity types (User, Community, Request, etc.)
- Event payload types

### utils/
Utility functions:
- Database query helpers
- Date formatting
- Error handling

### api/
Shared API client configuration

### constants/
Application constants:
- Role names
- Status values
- Default TTL values

## Usage in Services
```typescript
// Import middleware
import { authenticateToken, extractCommunityContext } from '@karmyq/shared/middleware/auth';

// Import types
import { ApiResponse, User } from '@karmyq/shared/types';

// Import utilities
import { formatDate } from '@karmyq/shared/utils';
```

## Adding Shared Code
1. Add to appropriate subdirectory
2. Export from index.ts
3. Run `npm run build` in packages/shared
4. Import in consuming service
Tool reply2025-11-23T00:04:39.735Z
File created successfully at: c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\packages\claude.md
Assistant2025-11-23T00:04:51.350Z
📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\tests\claude.md
c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\tests\claude.md
# Tests Directory

## Overview
Comprehensive test suite for the Karmyq platform.

## Test Types

### integration/
Multi-tenant integration tests using Jest:
- `auth.test.ts` - Authentication flows
- `tenant-isolation.test.ts` - RLS and community isolation
- `rls-policies.test.ts` - Row-level security verification
- `multi-community-flows.test.ts` - Cross-community scenarios
- `reputation-decay.test.ts` - Karma decay calculations
- `ephemeral-data.test.ts` - TTL and data expiration

### e2e/
End-to-end tests using Playwright:
- User registration and login
- Community creation and management
- Request/offer workflows
- Full user journeys

### load/
Performance tests using k6:
- API endpoint stress testing
- Concurrent user simulations
- Throughput benchmarks

### fixtures/
Test data generators:
- `users.ts` - User factory
- `communities.ts` - Community factory
- `requests.ts` - Request/offer factories
- `cleanup.ts` - Test data cleanup utilities

## Running Tests

```bash
cd tests

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Run integration tests
npm test

# Run specific test file
npm test -- auth.test.ts

# Run E2E tests
cd e2e && npx playwright test

# Run load tests
cd load && k6 run scenarios/api-load.js
```

## Test Environment
Tests use `docker-compose.test.yml` for isolated database:
- Separate PostgreSQL instance
- Fixtures loaded before tests
- Cleaned up after test runs

## Writing Tests
```typescript
import { createTestUser, createTestCommunity, cleanup } from './fixtures';

describe('Feature', () => {
  beforeEach(async () => {
    await cleanup();
  });

  it('should do something', async () => {
    const user = await createTestUser();
    const community = await createTestCommunity(user.id);
    // Test logic
  });
});
```

📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\scripts\claude.md
c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\scripts\claude.md
# Scripts Directory

## Overview
Development and operational scripts for the Karmyq platform.

## Subdirectories

### dev/
Development helper scripts:
- `start.sh` - Start development environment
- `reset-db.sh` - Reset database to clean state
- `seed-data.sh` - Populate test data

### setup/
Initial setup scripts:
- Environment configuration
- Dependency installation
- First-run initialization

### data/
Data management scripts:
- Export utilities
- Import utilities
- Migration helpers

## Usage Examples

```bash
# Start development environment
bash scripts/dev/start.sh

# Reset and reseed database
bash scripts/dev/reset-db.sh
bash scripts/dev/seed-data.sh
```

## Script Conventions
- Use bash for cross-platform compatibility
- Include error handling with `set -e`
- Log output to stdout/stderr appropriately
- Accept environment variables for configuration

📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\frontend\claude.md
c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\frontend\claude.md
# Frontend Web Application

## Overview
Next.js 14 web app with Pages Router and Tailwind CSS.

## Structure
```
src/
├── components/     # Reusable React components
│   └── Layout.tsx  # Main layout with navigation
├── lib/
│   └── api.ts      # API client with all service calls
├── pages/          # Next.js pages (file-based routing)
│   ├── _app.tsx    # App wrapper
│   ├── index.tsx   # Dashboard/Landing
│   ├── login.tsx   # Login page
│   ├── register.tsx
│   ├── communities/
│   │   ├── index.tsx       # List communities
│   │   ├── new.tsx         # Create community
│   │   ├── [id].tsx        # Community detail
│   │   └── [id]/admin.tsx  # Admin settings
│   ├── requests/
│   └── offers/
└── styles/
    └── globals.css # Tailwind imports
```

## API Client (`src/lib/api.ts`)
Centralized API client with service-specific modules:
- `authService` - Login, register, logout
- `communityService` - CRUD, members, norms, settings
- `requestService` - Help requests
- `offerService` - Help offers
- `feedService` - Activity feed

## Authentication Pattern
```typescript
// Check auth on mount
useEffect(() => {
  const token = localStorage.getItem('token');
  if (!token) router.push('/login');
}, []);

// API calls include token automatically via interceptor
```

## Environment Variables
```env
NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=http://localhost:3001
NEXT_PUBLIC_COMMUNITY_API_URL=http://localhost:3002
NEXT_PUBLIC_REQUEST_API_URL=http://localhost:3003
```

## Development
```bash
npm install
npm run dev     # http://localhost:3000
npm run build   # Production build
npm run lint    # ESLint
```

c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\claude.md
# Mobile Application

## Overview
React Native + Expo application for iOS and Android.

## Structure
```
├── app/              # Expo Router screens
│   ├── _layout.tsx   # Root layout
│   ├── index.tsx     # Home/Feed screen
│   ├── (tabs)/       # Tab-based navigation
│   └── (auth)/       # Auth screens
├── services/         # API service modules
│   ├── api.ts        # Base API client
│   ├── auth.ts       # Auth service
│   └── feed.ts       # Feed service
├── store/            # Redux Toolkit store
│   ├── index.ts      # Store configuration
│   ├── authSlice.ts  # Auth state
│   └── feedSlice.ts  # Feed state
├── components/       # Reusable components
└── constants/        # App constants
```

## Current Status
- Feed screen: Implemented
- Auth screens: Structure only
- Other screens: Pending

## Tech Stack
- Expo SDK 50+
- Expo Router (file-based routing)
- Redux Toolkit for state
- Axios for API calls
- React Native Paper (UI components)

## Development

### Prerequisites
- Node.js 18+
- Expo CLI: `npm install -g expo-cli`
- iOS: Xcode (Mac only)
- Android: Android Studio with emulator

### Running
```bash
cd apps/mobile
npm install

# Start Expo
npx expo start

# Options:
# Press 'i' - iOS Simulator
# Press 'a' - Android Emulator
# Scan QR - Expo Go app on device
```

### Environment
Create `.env`:
```env
EXPO_PUBLIC_API_URL=http://localhost:3001
```

Note: Use your machine's IP instead of localhost for physical devices.

## API Pattern
```typescript
// services/api.ts
import axios from 'axios';
import AsyncStorage from '@react-native-async-storage/async-storage';

const api = axios.create({
  baseURL: process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_API_URL,
});

// Add auth token from AsyncStorage
api.interceptors.request.use(async (config) => {
  const token = await AsyncStorage.getItem('token');
  if (token) config.headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${token}`;
  return config;
});
```

     1→import { Redirect } from 'expo-router';
     2→import { useAuthStore } from '@/store/auth';
     3→import { View, ActivityIndicator } from 'react-native';
     4→
     5→export default function Index() {
     6→  const { user, isLoading } = useAuthStore();
     7→
     8→  if (isLoading) {
     9→    return (
    10→      <View style={{ flex: 1, justifyContent: 'center', alignItems: 'center' }}>
    11→        <ActivityIndicator size="large" color="#3B82F6" />
    12→      </View>
    13→    );
    14→  }
    15→
    16→  // Redirect to tabs if authenticated, otherwise to login
    17→  return user ? <Redirect href="/(tabs)/feed" /> : <Redirect href="/(auth)/login" />;
    18→}
    19→

Tool reply2025-11-23T00:06:12.146Z
     1→import { Stack } from 'expo-router';
     2→import { useEffect } from 'react';
     3→import { registerForPushNotificationsAsync, setupNotificationHandlers } from '@/services/notifications';
     4→import { useAuthStore } from '@/store/auth';
     5→
     6→export default function RootLayout() {
     7→  const { user } = useAuthStore();
     8→
     9→  useEffect(() => {
    10→    if (user) {
    11→      // Register for push notifications when user logs in
    12→      registerForPushNotificationsAsync();
    13→      setupNotificationHandlers();
    14→    }
    15→  }, [user]);
    16→
    17→  return (
    18→    <Stack
    19→      screenOptions={{
    20→        headerStyle: {
    21→          backgroundColor: '#3B82F6',
    22→        },
    23→        headerTintColor: '#fff',
    24→        headerTitleStyle: {
    25→          fontWeight: 'bold',
    26→        },
    27→      }}
    28→    >
    29→      <Stack.Screen
    30→        name="index"
    31→        options={{
    32→          headerShown: false,
    33→        }}
    34→      />
    35→      <Stack.Screen
    36→        name="(auth)"
    37→        options={{
    38→          headerShown: false,
    39→        }}
    40→      />
    41→      <Stack.Screen
    42→        name="(tabs)"
    43→        options={{
    44→          headerShown: false,
    45→        }}
    46→      />
    47→    </Stack>
    48→  );
    49→}
    50→

Tool reply2025-11-23T00:06:12.148Z
     1→import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
     2→import {
     3→  View,
     4→  Text,
     5→  FlatList,
     6→  StyleSheet,
     7→  RefreshControl,
     8→  TouchableOpacity,
     9→  ActivityIndicator,
    10→} from 'react-native';
    11→import { Ionicons } from '@expo/vector-icons';
    12→import { router } from 'expo-router';
    13→import { api } from '@/services/api';
    14→import { useAuthStore } from '@/store/auth';
    15→
    16→interface FeedItem {
    17→  id: string;
    18→  type: string;
    19→  data: any;
    20→  created_at: string;
    21→}
    22→
    23→export default function FeedScreen() {
    24→  const { user } = useAuthStore();
    25→  const [feedItems, setFeedItems] = useState<FeedItem[]>([]);
    26→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
    27→  const [refreshing, setRefreshing] = useState(false);
    28→
    29→  const loadFeed = async () => {
    30→    if (!user) return;
    31→
    32→    try {
    33→      const response = await api.getFeed(user.id);
    34→      setFeedItems(response.data.items || []);
    35→    } catch (error) {
    36→      console.error('Failed to load feed:', error);
    37→    } finally {
    38→      setLoading(false);
    39→      setRefreshing(false);
    40→    }
    41→  };
    42→
    43→  useEffect(() => {
    44→    loadFeed();
    45→  }, [user]);
    46→
    47→  const onRefresh = () => {
    48→    setRefreshing(true);
    49→    loadFeed();
    50→  };
    51→
    52→  const renderFeedItem = ({ item }: { item: FeedItem }) => {
    53→    return (
    54→      <TouchableOpacity
    55→        style={styles.feedItem}
    56→        onPress={() => {
    57→          // Navigate to detail screen based on item type
    58→          if (item.type === 'open_request') {
    59→            router.push(`/requests/${item.data.request_id}`);
    60→          }
    61→        }}
    62→      >
    63→        <View style={styles.feedItemHeader}>
    64→          <Ionicons
    65→            name={getFeedItemIcon(item.type)}
    66→            size={24}
    67→            color="#3B82F6"
    68→          />
    69→          <Text style={styles.feedItemType}>{item.type.replace('_', ' ')}</Text>
    70→        </View>
    71→        <Text style={styles.feedItemTitle}>
    72→          {item.data.title || item.data.description}
    73→        </Text>
    74→        {item.data.community_name && (
    75→          <Text style={styles.feedItemCommunity}>
    76→            {item.data.community_name}
    77→          </Text>
    78→        )}
    79→      </TouchableOpacity>
    80→    );
    81→  };
    82→
    83→  const renderEmptyState = () => (
    84→    <View style={styles.emptyState}>
    85→      <Ionicons name="newspaper-outline" size={64} color="#9CA3AF" />
    86→      <Text style={styles.emptyStateTitle}>Your feed is empty</Text>
    87→      <Text style={styles.emptyStateText}>
    88→        Join communities and start helping to see activity here!
    89→      </Text>
    90→      <TouchableOpacity
    91→        style={styles.emptyStateButton}
    92→        onPress={() => router.push('/(tabs)/communities')}
    93→      >
    94→        <Text style={styles.emptyStateButtonText}>Explore Communities</Text>
    95→      </TouchableOpacity>
    96→    </View>
    97→  );
    98→
    99→  if (loading) {
   100→    return (
   101→      <View style={styles.loadingContainer}>
   102→        <ActivityIndicator size="large" color="#3B82F6" />
   103→      </View>
   104→    );
   105→  }
   106→
   107→  return (
   108→    <View style={styles.container}>
   109→      <FlatList
   110→        data={feedItems}
   111→        renderItem={renderFeedItem}
   112→        keyExtractor={(item) => item.id}
   113→        ListEmptyComponent={renderEmptyState}
   114→        refreshControl={
   115→          <RefreshControl refreshing={refreshing} onRefresh={onRefresh} />
   116→        }
   117→        contentContainerStyle={feedItems.length === 0 ? styles.emptyList : undefined}
   118→      />
   119→    </View>
   120→  );
   121→}
   122→
   123→function getFeedItemIcon(type: string): any {
   124→  switch (type) {
   125→    case 'community_activity':
   126→      return 'people';
   127→    case 'open_request':
   128→      return 'hand-right';
   129→    case 'suggested_request':
   130→      return 'bulb';
   131→    case 'story':
   132→      return 'trophy';
   133→    default:
   134→      return 'information-circle';
   135→  }
   136→}
   137→
   138→const styles = StyleSheet.create({
   139→  container: {
   140→    flex: 1,
   141→    backgroundColor: '#F3F4F6',
   142→  },
   143→  loadingContainer: {
   144→    flex: 1,
   145→    justifyContent: 'center',
   146→    alignItems: 'center',
   147→  },
   148→  feedItem: {
   149→    backgroundColor: '#FFFFFF',
   150→    padding: 16,
   151→    marginHorizontal: 16,
   152→    marginVertical: 8,
   153→    borderRadius: 8,
   154→    shadowColor: '#000',
   155→    shadowOffset: { width: 0, height: 1 },
   156→    shadowOpacity: 0.1,
   157→    shadowRadius: 2,
   158→    elevation: 2,
   159→  },
   160→  feedItemHeader: {
   161→    flexDirection: 'row',
   162→    alignItems: 'center',
   163→    marginBottom: 8,
   164→  },
   165→  feedItemType: {
   166→    fontSize: 12,
   167→    color: '#6B7280',
   168→    marginLeft: 8,
   169→    textTransform: 'capitalize',
   170→  },
   171→  feedItemTitle: {
   172→    fontSize: 16,
   173→    fontWeight: '600',
   174→    color: '#111827',
   175→    marginBottom: 4,
   176→  },
   177→  feedItemCommunity: {
   178→    fontSize: 14,
   179→    color: '#6B7280',
   180→  },
   181→  emptyList: {
   182→    flexGrow: 1,
   183→  },
   184→  emptyState: {
   185→    flex: 1,
   186→    justifyContent: 'center',
   187→    alignItems: 'center',
   188→    padding: 32,
   189→  },
   190→  emptyStateTitle: {
   191→    fontSize: 20,
   192→    fontWeight: 'bold',
   193→    color: '#111827',
   194→    marginTop: 16,
   195→    marginBottom: 8,
   196→  },
   197→  emptyStateText: {
   198→    fontSize: 14,
   199→    color: '#6B7280',
   200→    textAlign: 'center',
   201→    marginBottom: 24,
   202→  },
   203→  emptyStateButton: {
   204→    backgroundColor: '#3B82F6',
   205→    paddingHorizontal: 24,
   206→    paddingVertical: 12,
   207→    borderRadius: 8,
   208→  },
   209→  emptyStateButtonText: {
   210→    color: '#FFFFFF',
   211→    fontSize: 16,
   212→    fontWeight: '600',
   213→  },
   214→});

Tool reply2025-11-23T00:06:28.452Z
     1→import { create } from 'zustand';
     2→import { api } from '@/services/api';
     3→
     4→interface User {
     5→  id: string;
     6→  name: string;
     7→  email: string;
     8→}
     9→
    10→interface AuthStore {
    11→  user: User | null;
    12→  isLoading: boolean;
    13→  error: string | null;
    14→
    15→  login: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;
    16→  register: (name: string, email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;
    17→  logout: () => Promise<void>;
    18→  checkAuth: () => Promise<void>;
    19→}
    20→
    21→export const useAuthStore = create<AuthStore>((set) => ({
    22→  user: null,
    23→  isLoading: true,
    24→  error: null,
    25→
    26→  login: async (email: string, password: string) => {
    27→    try {
    28→      set({ isLoading: true, error: null });
    29→      const data = await api.login(email, password);
    30→      set({ user: data.user, isLoading: false });
    31→    } catch (error: any) {
    32→      set({
    33→        error: error.response?.data?.message || 'Login failed',
    34→        isLoading: false,
    35→      });
    36→      throw error;
    37→    }
    38→  },
    39→
    40→  register: async (name: string, email: string, password: string) => {
    41→    try {
    42→      set({ isLoading: true, error: null });
    43→      const data = await api.register({ name, email, password });
    44→      set({ user: data.user, isLoading: false });
    45→    } catch (error: any) {
    46→      set({
    47→        error: error.response?.data?.message || 'Registration failed',
    48→        isLoading: false,
    49→      });
    50→      throw error;
    51→    }
    52→  },
    53→
    54→  logout: async () => {
    55→    try {
    56→      await api.logout();
    57→      set({ user: null, error: null });
    58→    } catch (error) {
    59→      console.error('Logout error:', error);
    60→    }
    61→  },
    62→
    63→  checkAuth: async () => {
    64→    try {
    65→      set({ isLoading: true });
    66→      const user = await api.getCurrentUser();
    67→      set({ user, isLoading: false });
    68→    } catch (error) {
    69→      set({ user: null, isLoading: false });
    70→    }
    71→  },
    72→}));
    73→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>
Tool reply2025-11-23T00:06:29.664Z
     1→import axios, { AxiosInstance } from 'axios';
     2→import * as SecureStore from 'expo-secure-store';
     3→import Constants from 'expo-constants';
     4→
     5→// API configuration - can be overridden in app.json extra config
     6→const API_BASE_URL = Constants.expoConfig?.extra?.apiUrl || 'http://localhost:3001';
     7→
     8→class ApiService {
     9→  private authApi: AxiosInstance;
    10→  private communityApi: AxiosInstance;
    11→  private requestApi: AxiosInstance;
    12→  private reputationApi: AxiosInstance;
    13→  private notificationApi: AxiosInstance;
    14→  private messagingApi: AxiosInstance;
    15→  private feedApi: AxiosInstance;
    16→
    17→  constructor() {
    18→    // Create API instances for each service
    19→    this.authApi = this.createApiInstance(API_BASE_URL);
    20→    this.communityApi = this.createApiInstance(`${API_BASE_URL.replace(':3001', ':3002')}`);
    21→    this.requestApi = this.createApiInstance(`${API_BASE_URL.replace(':3001', ':3003')}`);
    22→    this.reputationApi = this.createApiInstance(`${API_BASE_URL.replace(':3001', ':3004')}`);
    23→    this.notificationApi = this.createApiInstance(`${API_BASE_URL.replace(':3001', ':3005')}`);
    24→    this.messagingApi = this.createApiInstance(`${API_BASE_URL.replace(':3001', ':3006')}`);
    25→    this.feedApi = this.createApiInstance(`${API_BASE_URL.replace(':3001', ':3007')}`);
    26→  }
    27→
    28→  private createApiInstance(baseURL: string): AxiosInstance {
    29→    const instance = axios.create({
    30→      baseURL,
    31→      timeout: 10000,
    32→      headers: {
    33→        'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    34→      },
    35→    });
    36→
    37→    // Add auth token to requests
    38→    instance.interceptors.request.use(
    39→      async (config) => {
    40→        const token = await SecureStore.getItemAsync('auth_token');
    41→        if (token) {
    42→          config.headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${token}`;
    43→        }
    44→        return config;
    45→      },
    46→      (error) => Promise.reject(error)
    47→    );
    48→
    49→    // Handle auth errors
    50→    instance.interceptors.response.use(
    51→      (response) => response,
    52→      async (error) => {
    53→        if (error.response?.status === 401) {
    54→          await SecureStore.deleteItemAsync('auth_token');
    55→          await SecureStore.deleteItemAsync('user');
    56→          // Redirect to login handled by app navigation
    57→        }
    58→        return Promise.reject(error);
    59→      }
    60→    );
    61→
    62→    return instance;
    63→  }
    64→
    65→  // Auth methods
    66→  async login(email: string, password: string) {
    67→    const response = await this.authApi.post('/login', { email, password });
    68→    if (response.data.token) {
    69→      await SecureStore.setItemAsync('auth_token', response.data.token);
    70→      await SecureStore.setItemAsync('user', JSON.stringify(response.data.user));
    71→    }
    72→    return response.data;
    73→  }
    74→
    75→  async register(data: { name: string; email: string; password: string }) {
    76→    const response = await this.authApi.post('/register', data);
    77→    if (response.data.token) {
    78→      await SecureStore.setItemAsync('auth_token', response.data.token);
    79→      await SecureStore.setItemAsync('user', JSON.stringify(response.data.user));
    80→    }
    81→    return response.data;
    82→  }
    83→
    84→  async logout() {
    85→    await SecureStore.deleteItemAsync('auth_token');
    86→    await SecureStore.deleteItemAsync('user');
    87→  }
    88→
    89→  async getCurrentUser() {
    90→    const userJson = await SecureStore.getItemAsync('user');
    91→    return userJson ? JSON.parse(userJson) : null;
    92→  }
    93→
    94→  // Community methods
    95→  async getCommunities(params?: any) {
    96→    const response = await this.communityApi.get('/communities', { params });
    97→    return response.data;
    98→  }
    99→
   100→  async getCommunity(id: string) {
   101→    const response = await this.communityApi.get(`/communities/${id}`);
   102→    return response.data;
   103→  }
   104→
   105→  async joinCommunity(communityId: string, userId: string) {
   106→    const response = await this.communityApi.post(`/communities/${communityId}/join`, {
   107→      user_id: userId,
   108→    });
   109→    return response.data;
   110→  }
   111→
   112→  // Request methods
   113→  async getRequests(params?: any) {
   114→    const response = await this.requestApi.get('/requests', { params });
   115→    return response.data;
   116→  }
   117→
   118→  async createRequest(data: any) {
   119→    const response = await this.requestApi.post('/requests', data);
   120→    return response.data;
   121→  }
   122→
   123→  async respondToRequest(requestId: string, data: any) {
   124→    const response = await this.requestApi.post(`/matches`, {
   125→      request_id: requestId,
   126→      ...data,
   127→    });
   128→    return response.data;
   129→  }
   130→
   131→  // Feed methods
   132→  async getFeed(userId: string, limit = 20) {
   133→    const response = await this.feedApi.get('/feed', {
   134→      params: { limit },
   135→      headers: { 'x-user-id': userId },
   136→    });
   137→    return response.data;
   138→  }
   139→
   140→  // Messaging methods
   141→  async getConversations(userId: string) {
   142→    const response = await this.messagingApi.get('/messages/conversations', {
   143→      params: { user_id: userId },
   144→    });
   145→    return response.data;
   146→  }
   147→
   148→  async getMessages(conversationId: string, userId: string) {
   149→    const response = await this.messagingApi.get(
   150→      `/messages/conversations/${conversationId}/messages`,
   151→      { params: { user_id: userId } }
   152→    );
   153→    return response.data;
   154→  }
   155→
   156→  async sendMessage(conversationId: string, senderId: string, content: string) {
   157→    const response = await this.messagingApi.post(
   158→      `/messages/conversations/${conversationId}/messages`,
   159→      { sender_id: senderId, content }
   160→    );
   161→    return response.data;
   162→  }
   163→
   164→  // Reputation methods
   165→  async getReputation(userId: string) {
   166→    const response = await this.reputationApi.get(`/reputation/karma/${userId}`);
   167→    return response.data;
   168→  }
   169→
   170→  // Notification methods
   171→  async registerPushToken(userId: string, pushToken: string) {
   172→    // TODO: Add endpoint to backend to store push tokens
   173→    const response = await this.notificationApi.post(`/notifications/${userId}/push-token`, {
   174→      token: pushToken,
   175→    });
   176→    return response.data;
   177→  }
   178→}
   179→
   180→export const api = new ApiService();
   181→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

  1. Auth screens (login/register)
  2. Tab screens (communities, requests, messages, profile)

Assistant2025-11-23T00:06:44.292Z


📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\app\(auth)\_layout.tsx


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\app\(auth)\_layout.tsx


import { Stack } from 'expo-router';

export default function AuthLayout() {
  return (
    <Stack
      screenOptions={{
        headerStyle: {
          backgroundColor: '#3B82F6',
        },
        headerTintColor: '#fff',
        headerTitleStyle: {
          fontWeight: 'bold',
        },
      }}
    >
      <Stack.Screen
        name="login"
        options={{
          title: 'Sign In',
        }}
      />
      <Stack.Screen
        name="register"
        options={{
          title: 'Create Account',
        }}
      />
    </Stack>
  );
}





Tool reply2025-11-23T00:06:45.576Z
File created successfully at: c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\app\(auth)\_layout.tsx


Assistant2025-11-23T00:07:03.450Z


📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\app\(auth)\login.tsx


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\app\(auth)\login.tsx


import { useState } from 'react';
import {
  View,
  Text,
  TextInput,
  TouchableOpacity,
  StyleSheet,
  KeyboardAvoidingView,
  Platform,
  ActivityIndicator,
  Alert,
} from 'react-native';
import { router } from 'expo-router';
import { useAuthStore } from '@/store/auth';
import { Ionicons } from '@expo/vector-icons';

export default function LoginScreen() {
  const [email, setEmail] = useState('');
  const [password, setPassword] = useState('');
  const [showPassword, setShowPassword] = useState(false);
  const { login, isLoading, error } = useAuthStore();

  const handleLogin = async () => {
    if (!email || !password) {
      Alert.alert('Error', 'Please enter email and password');
      return;
    }

    try {
      await login(email, password);
      router.replace('/(tabs)/feed');
    } catch (err: any) {
      Alert.alert('Login Failed', err.response?.data?.message || 'Invalid credentials');
    }
  };

  return (
    <KeyboardAvoidingView
      behavior={Platform.OS === 'ios' ? 'padding' : 'height'}
      style={styles.container}
    >
      <View style={styles.content}>
        <View style={styles.header}>
          <Ionicons name="heart-circle" size={80} color="#3B82F6" />
          <Text style={styles.title}>Welcome to Karmyq</Text>
          <Text style={styles.subtitle}>Sign in to continue helping your community</Text>
        </View>

        <View style={styles.form}>
          <View style={styles.inputContainer}>
            <Ionicons name="mail-outline" size={20} color="#9CA3AF" style={styles.inputIcon} />
            <TextInput
              style={styles.input}
              placeholder="Email"
              value={email}
              onChangeText={setEmail}
              keyboardType="email-address"
              autoCapitalize="none"
              autoComplete="email"
            />
          </View>

          <View style={styles.inputContainer}>
            <Ionicons name="lock-closed-outline" size={20} color="#9CA3AF" style={styles.inputIcon} />
            <TextInput
              style={styles.input}
              placeholder="Password"
              value={password}
              onChangeText={setPassword}
              secureTextEntry={!showPassword}
              autoComplete="password"
            />
            <TouchableOpacity onPress={() => setShowPassword(!showPassword)}>
              <Ionicons
                name={showPassword ? 'eye-off-outline' : 'eye-outline'}
                size={20}
                color="#9CA3AF"
              />
            </TouchableOpacity>
          </View>

          {error && <Text style={styles.errorText}>{error}</Text>}

          <TouchableOpacity
            style={[styles.button, isLoading && styles.buttonDisabled]}
            onPress={handleLogin}
            disabled={isLoading}
          >
            {isLoading ? (
              <ActivityIndicator color="#fff" />
            ) : (
              <Text style={styles.buttonText}>Sign In</Text>
            )}
          </TouchableOpacity>

          <View style={styles.footer}>
            <Text style={styles.footerText}>Don't have an account? </Text>
            <TouchableOpacity onPress={() => router.push('/(auth)/register')}>
              <Text style={styles.footerLink}>Sign Up</Text>
            </TouchableOpacity>
          </View>
        </View>
      </View>
    </KeyboardAvoidingView>
  );
}

const styles = StyleSheet.create({
  container: {
    flex: 1,
    backgroundColor: '#F3F4F6',
  },
  content: {
    flex: 1,
    justifyContent: 'center',
    padding: 24,
  },
  header: {
    alignItems: 'center',
    marginBottom: 32,
  },
  title: {
    fontSize: 28,
    fontWeight: 'bold',
    color: '#111827',
    marginTop: 16,
  },
  subtitle: {
    fontSize: 14,
    color: '#6B7280',
    marginTop: 8,
    textAlign: 'center',
  },
  form: {
    backgroundColor: '#FFFFFF',
    borderRadius: 16,
    padding: 24,
    shadowColor: '#000',
    shadowOffset: { width: 0, height: 2 },
    shadowOpacity: 0.1,
    shadowRadius: 4,
    elevation: 3,
  },
  inputContainer: {
    flexDirection: 'row',
    alignItems: 'center',
    borderWidth: 1,
    borderColor: '#E5E7EB',
    borderRadius: 12,
    paddingHorizontal: 16,
    marginBottom: 16,
    backgroundColor: '#F9FAFB',
  },
  inputIcon: {
    marginRight: 12,
  },
  input: {
    flex: 1,
    height: 50,
    fontSize: 16,
    color: '#111827',
  },
  errorText: {
    color: '#EF4444',
    fontSize: 14,
    marginBottom: 16,
    textAlign: 'center',
  },
  button: {
    backgroundColor: '#3B82F6',
    borderRadius: 12,
    height: 50,
    justifyContent: 'center',
    alignItems: 'center',
    marginTop: 8,
  },
  buttonDisabled: {
    backgroundColor: '#93C5FD',
  },
  buttonText: {
    color: '#FFFFFF',
    fontSize: 16,
    fontWeight: '600',
  },
  footer: {
    flexDirection: 'row',
    justifyContent: 'center',
    marginTop: 24,
  },
  footerText: {
    color: '#6B7280',
    fontSize: 14,
  },
  footerLink: {
    color: '#3B82F6',
    fontSize: 14,
    fontWeight: '600',
  },
});

Assistant2025-11-23T00:07:23.795Z


📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\app\(auth)\register.tsx


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\app\(auth)\register.tsx


import { useState } from 'react';
import {
  View,
  Text,
  TextInput,
  TouchableOpacity,
  StyleSheet,
  KeyboardAvoidingView,
  Platform,
  ActivityIndicator,
  Alert,
  ScrollView,
} from 'react-native';
import { router } from 'expo-router';
import { useAuthStore } from '@/store/auth';
import { Ionicons } from '@expo/vector-icons';

export default function RegisterScreen() {
  const [name, setName] = useState('');
  const [email, setEmail] = useState('');
  const [password, setPassword] = useState('');
  const [confirmPassword, setConfirmPassword] = useState('');
  const [showPassword, setShowPassword] = useState(false);
  const { register, isLoading, error } = useAuthStore();

  const handleRegister = async () => {
    if (!name || !email || !password) {
      Alert.alert('Error', 'Please fill in all fields');
      return;
    }

    if (password !== confirmPassword) {
      Alert.alert('Error', 'Passwords do not match');
      return;
    }

    if (password.length < 8) {
      Alert.alert('Error', 'Password must be at least 8 characters');
      return;
    }

    try {
      await register(name, email, password);
      router.replace('/(tabs)/feed');
    } catch (err: any) {
      Alert.alert('Registration Failed', err.response?.data?.message || 'Could not create account');
    }
  };

  return (
    <KeyboardAvoidingView
      behavior={Platform.OS === 'ios' ? 'padding' : 'height'}
      style={styles.container}
    >
      <ScrollView contentContainerStyle={styles.scrollContent}>
        <View style={styles.content}>
          <View style={styles.header}>
            <Ionicons name="person-add" size={60} color="#3B82F6" />
            <Text style={styles.title}>Create Account</Text>
            <Text style={styles.subtitle}>Join Karmyq and start helping your community</Text>
          </View>

          <View style={styles.form}>
            <View style={styles.inputContainer}>
              <Ionicons name="person-outline" size={20} color="#9CA3AF" style={styles.inputIcon} />
              <TextInput
                style={styles.input}
                placeholder="Full Name"
                value={name}
                onChangeText={setName}
                autoCapitalize="words"
                autoComplete="name"
              />
            </View>

            <View style={styles.inputContainer}>
              <Ionicons name="mail-outline" size={20} color="#9CA3AF" style={styles.inputIcon} />
              <TextInput
                style={styles.input}
                placeholder="Email"
                value={email}
                onChangeText={setEmail}
                keyboardType="email-address"
                autoCapitalize="none"
                autoComplete="email"
              />
            </View>

            <View style={styles.inputContainer}>
              <Ionicons name="lock-closed-outline" size={20} color="#9CA3AF" style={styles.inputIcon} />
              <TextInput
                style={styles.input}
                placeholder="Password"
                value={password}
                onChangeText={setPassword}
                secureTextEntry={!showPassword}
                autoComplete="new-password"
              />
              <TouchableOpacity onPress={() => setShowPassword(!showPassword)}>
                <Ionicons
                  name={showPassword ? 'eye-off-outline' : 'eye-outline'}
                  size={20}
                  color="#9CA3AF"
                />
              </TouchableOpacity>
            </View>

            <View style={styles.inputContainer}>
              <Ionicons name="lock-closed-outline" size={20} color="#9CA3AF" style={styles.inputIcon} />
              <TextInput
                style={styles.input}
                placeholder="Confirm Password"
                value={confirmPassword}
                onChangeText={setConfirmPassword}
                secureTextEntry={!showPassword}
              />
            </View>

            {error && <Text style={styles.errorText}>{error}</Text>}

            <TouchableOpacity
              style={[styles.button, isLoading && styles.buttonDisabled]}
              onPress={handleRegister}
              disabled={isLoading}
            >
              {isLoading ? (
                <ActivityIndicator color="#fff" />
              ) : (
                <Text style={styles.buttonText}>Create Account</Text>
              )}
            </TouchableOpacity>

            <View style={styles.footer}>
              <Text style={styles.footerText}>Already have an account? </Text>
              <TouchableOpacity onPress={() => router.back()}>
                <Text style={styles.footerLink}>Sign In</Text>
              </TouchableOpacity>
            </View>
          </View>
        </View>
      </ScrollView>
    </KeyboardAvoidingView>
  );
}

const styles = StyleSheet.create({
  container: {
    flex: 1,
    backgroundColor: '#F3F4F6',
  },
  scrollContent: {
    flexGrow: 1,
  },
  content: {
    flex: 1,
    justifyContent: 'center',
    padding: 24,
  },
  header: {
    alignItems: 'center',
    marginBottom: 32,
  },
  title: {
    fontSize: 28,
    fontWeight: 'bold',
    color: '#111827',
    marginTop: 16,
  },
  subtitle: {
    fontSize: 14,
    color: '#6B7280',
    marginTop: 8,
    textAlign: 'center',
  },
  form: {
    backgroundColor: '#FFFFFF',
    borderRadius: 16,
    padding: 24,
    shadowColor: '#000',
    shadowOffset: { width: 0, height: 2 },
    shadowOpacity: 0.1,
    shadowRadius: 4,
    elevation: 3,
  },
  inputContainer: {
    flexDirection: 'row',
    alignItems: 'center',
    borderWidth: 1,
    borderColor: '#E5E7EB',
    borderRadius: 12,
    paddingHorizontal: 16,
    marginBottom: 16,
    backgroundColor: '#F9FAFB',
  },
  inputIcon: {
    marginRight: 12,
  },
  input: {
    flex: 1,
    height: 50,
    fontSize: 16,
    color: '#111827',
  },
  errorText: {
    color: '#EF4444',
    fontSize: 14,
    marginBottom: 16,
    textAlign: 'center',
  },
  button: {
    backgroundColor: '#3B82F6',
    borderRadius: 12,
    height: 50,
    justifyContent: 'center',
    alignItems: 'center',
    marginTop: 8,
  },
  buttonDisabled: {
    backgroundColor: '#93C5FD',
  },
  buttonText: {
    color: '#FFFFFF',
    fontSize: 16,
    fontWeight: '600',
  },
  footer: {
    flexDirection: 'row',
    justifyContent: 'center',
    marginTop: 24,
  },
  footerText: {
    color: '#6B7280',
    fontSize: 14,
  },
  footerLink: {
    color: '#3B82F6',
    fontSize: 14,
    fontWeight: '600',
  },
});
