Tool reply2025-11-23T00:13:49.335Z
     1→import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
     2→import { useRouter } from 'next/router'
     3→import Head from 'next/head'
     4→import Link from 'next/link'
     5→import { communityService } from '@/lib/api'
     6→import Layout from '@/components/Layout'
     7→
     8→interface Member {
     9→  id: string
    10→  user_id: string
    11→  user_name: string
    12→  user_email: string
    13→  role: string
    14→  status: string
    15→  joined_at: string
    16→  invited_by_name?: string
    17→}
    18→
    19→interface CommunitySettings {
    20→  request_ttl_days: number
    21→  offer_ttl_days: number
    22→  match_ttl_days: number
    23→  notification_ttl_days: number
    24→  message_ttl_days: number
    25→  session_ttl_days: number
    26→  karma_decay_enabled: boolean
    27→  karma_half_life_months: number
    28→}
    29→
    30→interface Community {
    31→  id: string
    32→  name: string
    33→  description: string
    34→  current_members: number
    35→  max_members: number
    36→  access_type: 'public' | 'private'
    37→  creator_id: string
    38→  creator_name: string
    39→  status: string
    40→  members: Member[]
    41→}
    42→
    43→export default function CommunityAdminPage() {
    44→  const router = useRouter()
    45→  const { id } = router.query
    46→  const [community, setCommunity] = useState<Community | null>(null)
    47→  const [settings, setSettings] = useState<CommunitySettings | null>(null)
    48→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
    49→  const [error, setError] = useState('')
    50→  const [currentUser, setCurrentUser] = useState<any>(null)
    51→  const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState<'members' | 'pending' | 'settings'>('members')
    52→  const [saving, setSaving] = useState(false)
    53→  const [editedSettings, setEditedSettings] = useState<CommunitySettings | null>(null)
    54→
    55→  useEffect(() => {
    56→    const token = localStorage.getItem('token')
    57→    const userData = localStorage.getItem('user')
    58→    if (!token) {
    59→      router.push('/login')
    60→      return
    61→    }
    62→    if (userData) {
    63→      setCurrentUser(JSON.parse(userData))
    64→    }
    65→  }, [router])
    66→
    67→  useEffect(() => {
    68→    if (id) {
    69→      fetchCommunity()
    70→      fetchSettings()
    71→    }
    72→  }, [id])
    73→
    74→  const fetchCommunity = async () => {
    75→    try {
    76→      setLoading(true)
    77→      const response = await communityService.getCommunity(id as string)
    78→      setCommunity(response.data.data)
    79→    } catch (err: any) {
    80→      setError(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to load community')
    81→    } finally {
    82→      setLoading(false)
    83→    }
    84→  }
    85→
    86→  const fetchSettings = async () => {
    87→    try {
    88→      const response = await communityService.getSettings(id as string)
    89→      setSettings(response.data.data)
    90→      setEditedSettings(response.data.data)
    91→    } catch (err: any) {
    92→      console.error('Failed to load settings:', err)
    93→      // Use defaults if settings not found
    94→      const defaults: CommunitySettings = {
    95→        request_ttl_days: 60,
    96→        offer_ttl_days: 60,
    97→        match_ttl_days: 90,
    98→        notification_ttl_days: 30,
    99→        message_ttl_days: 90,
   100→        session_ttl_days: 30,
   101→        karma_decay_enabled: true,
   102→        karma_half_life_months: 6
   103→      }
   104→      setSettings(defaults)
   105→      setEditedSettings(defaults)
   106→    }
   107→  }
   108→
   109→  const handleUpdateMemberRole = async (userId: string, newRole: string) => {
   110→    if (!currentUser || !id) return
   111→
   112→    try {
   113→      await communityService.updateMember(id as string, userId, {
   114→        role: newRole,
   115→        admin_user_id: currentUser.id
   116→      })
   117→      fetchCommunity()
   118→    } catch (err: any) {
   119→      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to update member role')
   120→    }
   121→  }
   122→
   123→  const handleApproveMember = async (userId: string) => {
   124→    if (!currentUser || !id) return
   125→
   126→    try {
   127→      await communityService.updateMember(id as string, userId, {
   128→        status: 'active',
   129→        admin_user_id: currentUser.id
   130→      })
   131→      fetchCommunity()
   132→    } catch (err: any) {
   133→      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to approve member')
   134→    }
   135→  }
   136→
   137→  const handleRejectMember = async (userId: string) => {
   138→    if (!currentUser || !id) return
   139→
   140→    try {
   141→      await communityService.removeMember(id as string, userId, currentUser.id)
   142→      fetchCommunity()
   143→    } catch (err: any) {
   144→      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to reject member')
   145→    }
   146→  }
   147→
   148→  const handleRemoveMember = async (userId: string, userName: string) => {
   149→    if (!currentUser || !id) return
   150→
   151→    if (!confirm(`Are you sure you want to remove ${userName} from the community?`)) {
   152→      return
   153→    }
   154→
   155→    try {
   156→      await communityService.removeMember(id as string, userId, currentUser.id)
   157→      fetchCommunity()
   158→    } catch (err: any) {
   159→      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to remove member')
   160→    }
   161→  }
   162→
   163→  const handleSaveSettings = async () => {
   164→    if (!currentUser || !id || !editedSettings) return
   165→
   166→    setSaving(true)
   167→    try {
   168→      await communityService.updateSettings(id as string, {
   169→        ...editedSettings,
   170→        user_id: currentUser.id
   171→      })
   172→      setSettings(editedSettings)
   173→      alert('Settings saved successfully!')
   174→    } catch (err: any) {
   175→      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to save settings')
   176→    } finally {
   177→      setSaving(false)
   178→    }
   179→  }
   180→
   181→  // Check if current user is admin
   182→  const membershipRecord = community?.members.find((m: Member) => m.user_id === currentUser?.id)
   183→  const isAdmin = membershipRecord?.role === 'admin' && membershipRecord?.status === 'active'
   184→
   185→  // Filter members by status
   186→  const activeMembers = community?.members.filter(m => m.status === 'active') || []
   187→  const pendingMembers = community?.members.filter(m => m.status === 'pending') || []
   188→
   189→  if (loading) {
   190→    return (
   191→      <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center">
   192→        <div className="text-gray-500">Loading...</div>
   193→      </div>
   194→    )
   195→  }
   196→
   197→  if (error || !community) {
   198→    return (
   199→      <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center">
   200→        <div className="text-red-500">{error || 'Community not found'}</div>
   201→      </div>
   202→    )
   203→  }
   204→
   205→  if (!isAdmin) {
   206→    return (
   207→      <Layout title="Access Denied">
   208→        <div className="container mx-auto px-4 py-8">
   209→          <div className="bg-red-50 border border-red-200 rounded-lg p-8 text-center">
   210→            <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold text-red-800 mb-4">Access Denied</h2>
   211→            <p className="text-red-600 mb-6">You must be a community admin to access this page.</p>
   212→            <Link
   213→              href={`/communities/${id}`}
   214→              className="px-6 py-2 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded hover:bg-blue-700"
   215→            >
   216→              Back to Community
   217→            </Link>
   218→          </div>
   219→        </div>
   220→      </Layout>
   221→    )
   222→  }
   223→
   224→  return (
   225→    <>
   226→      <Head>
   227→        <title>Admin - {community.name} - Karmyq</title>
   228→      </Head>
   229→      <Layout title={`Admin: ${community.name}`}>
   230→        <div className="container mx-auto px-4 py-8">
   231→          {/* Header */}
   232→          <div className="flex items-center justify-between mb-6">
   233→            <div>
   234→              <Link
   235→                href={`/communities/${id}`}
   236→                className="text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-800 mb-2 inline-block"
   237→              >
   238→                ← Back to Community
   239→              </Link>
   240→              <h1 className="text-3xl font-bold">{community.name} - Admin Panel</h1>
   241→            </div>
   242→          </div>
   243→
   244→          {/* Stats Cards */}
   245→          <div className="grid md:grid-cols-4 gap-4 mb-6">
   246→            <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow p-4">
   247→              <div className="text-3xl font-bold text-blue-600">{activeMembers.length}</div>
   248→              <div className="text-sm text-gray-600">Active Members</div>
   249→            </div>
   250→            <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow p-4">
   251→              <div className="text-3xl font-bold text-yellow-600">{pendingMembers.length}</div>
   252→              <div className="text-sm text-gray-600">Pending Requests</div>
   253→            </div>
   254→            <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow p-4">
   255→              <div className="text-3xl font-bold text-green-600">{community.max_members}</div>
   256→              <div className="text-sm text-gray-600">Max Capacity</div>
   257→            </div>
   258→            <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow p-4">
   259→              <div className="text-3xl font-bold text-purple-600">
   260→                {community.access_type === 'private' ? 'Private' : 'Public'}
   261→              </div>
   262→              <div className="text-sm text-gray-600">Access Type</div>
   263→            </div>
   264→          </div>
   265→
   266→          {/* Tabs */}
   267→          <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow">
   268→            <div className="border-b border-gray-200">
   269→              <nav className="flex">
   270→                <button
   271→                  onClick={() => setActiveTab('members')}
   272→                  className={`px-6 py-4 font-medium ${
   273→                    activeTab === 'members'
   274→                      ? 'border-b-2 border-blue-600 text-blue-600'
   275→                      : 'text-gray-600 hover:text-gray-800'
   276→                  }`}
   277→                >
   278→                  Members ({activeMembers.length})
   279→                </button>
   280→                <button
   281→                  onClick={() => setActiveTab('pending')}
   282→                  className={`px-6 py-4 font-medium relative ${
   283→                    activeTab === 'pending'
   284→                      ? 'border-b-2 border-blue-600 text-blue-600'
   285→                      : 'text-gray-600 hover:text-gray-800'
   286→                  }`}
   287→                >
   288→                  Pending Requests ({pendingMembers.length})
   289→                  {pendingMembers.length > 0 && (
   290→                    <span className="absolute -top-1 -right-1 bg-red-500 text-white text-xs rounded-full w-5 h-5 flex items-center justify-center">
   291→                      {pendingMembers.length}
   292→                    </span>
   293→                  )}
   294→                </button>
   295→                <button
   296→                  onClick={() => setActiveTab('settings')}
   297→                  className={`px-6 py-4 font-medium ${
   298→                    activeTab === 'settings'
   299→                      ? 'border-b-2 border-blue-600 text-blue-600'
   300→                      : 'text-gray-600 hover:text-gray-800'
   301→                  }`}
   302→                >
   303→                  Settings
   304→                </button>
   305→              </nav>
   306→            </div>
   307→
   308→            <div className="p-6">
   309→              {/* Active Members Tab */}
   310→              {activeTab === 'members' && (
   311→                <div>
   312→                  <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-4">Manage Members</h3>
   313→                  <div className="space-y-3">
   314→                    {activeMembers.map((member) => (
   315→                      <div
   316→                        key={member.id}
   317→                        className="flex items-center justify-between p-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg"
   318→                      >
   319→                        <div>
   320→                          <div className="font-semibold">{member.user_name}</div>
   321→                          <div className="text-sm text-gray-600">{member.user_email}</div>
   322→                          <div className="text-xs text-gray-500">
   323→                            Joined {new Date(member.joined_at).toLocaleDateString()}
   324→                          </div>
   325→                        </div>
   326→                        <div className="flex items-center gap-3">
   327→                          <select
   328→                            value={member.role}
   329→                            onChange={(e) => handleUpdateMemberRole(member.user_id, e.target.value)}
   330→                            disabled={member.user_id === currentUser?.id || member.user_id === community.creator_id}
   331→                            className="px-3 py-1 border border-gray-300 rounded text-sm disabled:bg-gray-100"
   332→                          >
   333→                            <option value="member">Member</option>
   334→                            <option value="moderator">Moderator</option>
   335→                            <option value="admin">Admin</option>
   336→                          </select>
   337→                          {member.user_id !== currentUser?.id && member.user_id !== community.creator_id && (
   338→                            <button
   339→                              onClick={() => handleRemoveMember(member.user_id, member.user_name)}
   340→                              className="px-3 py-1 bg-red-100 text-red-700 rounded text-sm hover:bg-red-200"
   341→                            >
   342→                              Remove
   343→                            </button>
   344→                          )}
   345→                          {member.user_id === community.creator_id && (
   346→                            <span className="px-3 py-1 bg-purple-100 text-purple-700 rounded text-sm">
   347→                              Creator
   348→                            </span>
   349→                          )}
   350→                        </div>
   351→                      </div>
   352→                    ))}
   353→                  </div>
   354→                </div>
   355→              )}
   356→
   357→              {/* Pending Requests Tab */}
   358→              {activeTab === 'pending' && (
   359→                <div>
   360→                  <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-4">Pending Join Requests</h3>
   361→                  {pendingMembers.length === 0 ? (
   362→                    <p className="text-gray-500">No pending join requests.</p>
   363→                  ) : (
   364→                    <div className="space-y-3">
   365→                      {pendingMembers.map((member) => (
   366→                        <div
   367→                          key={member.id}
   368→                          className="flex items-center justify-between p-4 bg-yellow-50 border border-yellow-200 rounded-lg"
   369→                        >
   370→                          <div>
   371→                            <div className="font-semibold">{member.user_name}</div>
   372→                            <div className="text-sm text-gray-600">{member.user_email}</div>
   373→                            <div className="text-xs text-gray-500">
   374→                              Requested {new Date(member.joined_at).toLocaleDateString()}
   375→                            </div>
   376→                          </div>
   377→                          <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
   378→                            <button
   379→                              onClick={() => handleApproveMember(member.user_id)}
   380→                              className="px-4 py-2 bg-green-600 text-white rounded hover:bg-green-700"
   381→                            >
   382→                              Approve
   383→                            </button>
   384→                            <button
   385→                              onClick={() => handleRejectMember(member.user_id)}
   386→                              className="px-4 py-2 bg-red-600 text-white rounded hover:bg-red-700"
   387→                            >
   388→                              Reject
   389→                            </button>
   390→                          </div>
   391→                        </div>
   392→                      ))}
   393→                    </div>
   394→                  )}
   395→                </div>
   396→              )}
   397→
   398→              {/* Settings Tab */}
   399→              {activeTab === 'settings' && editedSettings && (
   400→                <div>
   401→                  <h3 className="text-xl font-semibold mb-4">Community Settings</h3>
   402→                  <p className="text-gray-600 mb-6">
   403→                    Configure data retention and reputation decay settings for this community.
   404→                  </p>
   405→
   406→                  <div className="space-y-6">
   407→                    {/* Data Retention Section */}
   408→                    <div className="bg-gray-50 rounded-lg p-6">
   409→                      <h4 className="font-semibold text-lg mb-4">Data Retention (TTL)</h4>
   410→                      <p className="text-sm text-gray-600 mb-4">
   411→                        Set how long different types of data are kept before automatic cleanup.
   412→                      </p>
   413→                      <div className="grid md:grid-cols-2 gap-4">
   414→                        <div>
   415→                          <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
   416→                            Help Requests (days)
   417→                          </label>
   418→                          <input
   419→                            type="number"
   420→                            value={editedSettings.request_ttl_days}
   421→                            onChange={(e) => setEditedSettings({
   422→                              ...editedSettings,
   423→                              request_ttl_days: parseInt(e.target.value) || 60
   424→                            })}
   425→                            className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded"
   426→                            min="1"
   427→                            max="365"
   428→                          />
   429→                        </div>
   430→                        <div>
   431→                          <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
   432→                            Help Offers (days)
   433→                          </label>
   434→                          <input
   435→                            type="number"
   436→                            value={editedSettings.offer_ttl_days}
   437→                            onChange={(e) => setEditedSettings({
   438→                              ...editedSettings,
   439→                              offer_ttl_days: parseInt(e.target.value) || 60
   440→                            })}
   441→                            className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded"
   442→                            min="1"
   443→                            max="365"
   444→                          />
   445→                        </div>
   446→                        <div>
   447→                          <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
   448→                            Completed Matches (days)
   449→                          </label>
   450→                          <input
   451→                            type="number"
   452→                            value={editedSettings.match_ttl_days}
   453→                            onChange={(e) => setEditedSettings({
   454→                              ...editedSettings,
   455→                              match_ttl_days: parseInt(e.target.value) || 90
   456→                            })}
   457→                            className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded"
   458→                            min="1"
   459→                            max="365"
   460→                          />
   461→                        </div>
   462→                        <div>
   463→                          <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
   464→                            Notifications (days)
   465→                          </label>
   466→                          <input
   467→                            type="number"
   468→                            value={editedSettings.notification_ttl_days}
   469→                            onChange={(e) => setEditedSettings({
   470→                              ...editedSettings,
   471→                              notification_ttl_days: parseInt(e.target.value) || 30
   472→                            })}
   473→                            className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded"
   474→                            min="1"
   475→                            max="365"
   476→                          />
   477→                        </div>
   478→                        <div>
   479→                          <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
   480→                            Messages (days)
   481→                          </label>
   482→                          <input
   483→                            type="number"
   484→                            value={editedSettings.message_ttl_days}
   485→                            onChange={(e) => setEditedSettings({
   486→                              ...editedSettings,
   487→                              message_ttl_days: parseInt(e.target.value) || 90
   488→                            })}
   489→                            className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded"
   490→                            min="1"
   491→                            max="365"
   492→                          />
   493→                        </div>
   494→                        <div>
   495→                          <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
   496→                            Sessions (days)
   497→                          </label>
   498→                          <input
   499→                            type="number"
   500→                            value={editedSettings.session_ttl_days}
   501→                            onChange={(e) => setEditedSettings({
   502→                              ...editedSettings,
   503→                              session_ttl_days: parseInt(e.target.value) || 30
   504→                            })}
   505→                            className="w-full px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded"
   506→                            min="1"
   507→                            max="365"
   508→                          />
   509→                        </div>
   510→                      </div>
   511→                    </div>
   512→
   513→                    {/* Reputation Decay Section */}
   514→                    <div className="bg-gray-50 rounded-lg p-6">
   515→                      <h4 className="font-semibold text-lg mb-4">Reputation Decay</h4>
   516→                      <p className="text-sm text-gray-600 mb-4">
   517→                        Configure how karma decays over time to encourage ongoing participation.
   518→                      </p>
   519→                      <div className="space-y-4">
   520→                        <div className="flex items-center gap-3">
   521→                          <input
   522→                            type="checkbox"
   523→                            id="karma_decay_enabled"
   524→                            checked={editedSettings.karma_decay_enabled}
   525→                            onChange={(e) => setEditedSettings({
   526→                              ...editedSettings,
   527→                              karma_decay_enabled: e.target.checked
   528→                            })}
   529→                            className="w-5 h-5 rounded"
   530→                          />
   531→                          <label htmlFor="karma_decay_enabled" className="font-medium">
   532→                            Enable karma decay
   533→                          </label>
   534→                        </div>
   535→                        {editedSettings.karma_decay_enabled && (
   536→                          <div className="ml-8">
   537→                            <label className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1">
   538→                              Decay half-life (months)
   539→                            </label>
   540→                            <p className="text-xs text-gray-500 mb-2">
   541→                              Time for karma to decay to half its value without activity
   542→                            </p>
   543→                            <input
   544→                              type="number"
   545→                              value={editedSettings.karma_half_life_months}
   546→                              onChange={(e) => setEditedSettings({
   547→                                ...editedSettings,
   548→                                karma_half_life_months: parseInt(e.target.value) || 6
   549→                              })}
   550→                              className="w-32 px-4 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded"
   551→                              min="1"
   552→                              max="24"
   553→                            />
   554→                          </div>
   555→                        )}
   556→                      </div>
   557→                    </div>
   558→
   559→                    {/* Save Button */}
   560→                    <div className="flex justify-end gap-3">
   561→                      <button
   562→                        onClick={() => setEditedSettings(settings)}
   563→                        className="px-6 py-2 bg-gray-200 text-gray-700 rounded hover:bg-gray-300"
   564→                      >
   565→                        Reset
   566→                      </button>
   567→                      <button
   568→                        onClick={handleSaveSettings}
   569→                        disabled={saving}
   570→                        className="px-6 py-2 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded hover:bg-blue-700 disabled:bg-blue-400"
   571→                      >
   572→                        {saving ? 'Saving...' : 'Save Settings'}
   573→                      </button>
   574→                    </div>
   575→                  </div>
   576→                </div>
   577→              )}
   578→            </div>
   579→          </div>
   580→        </div>
   581→      </Layout>
   582→    </>
   583→  )
   584→}
   585→

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

Assistant2025-11-23T00:14:14.111Z


✏️ Edit c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\frontend\src\pages\communities\[id]\admin.tsx


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\frontend\src\pages\communities\[id]\admin.tsx




−
const handleSaveSettings = async () => {
    if (!currentUser || !id || !editedSettings) return

    setSaving(true)
    try {
      await communityService.updateSettings(id as string, {
        ...editedSettings,
        user_id: currentUser.id
      })
      setSettings(editedSettings)
      alert('Settings saved successfully!')
    } catch (err: any) {
      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to save settings')
    } finally {
      setSaving(false)
    }
  }


+
const handleSaveSettings = async () => {
    if (!currentUser || !id || !editedSettings) return

    setSaving(true)
    try {
      await communityService.updateSettings(id as string, {
        ...editedSettings,
        user_id: currentUser.id
      })
      setSettings(editedSettings)
      alert('Settings saved successfully!')
    } catch (err: any) {
      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to save settings')
    } finally {
      setSaving(false)
    }
  }

  const handleExport = async (type: 'full' | 'members' | 'activity', format: 'json' | 'csv') => {
    if (!id) return
    setExporting(true)
    try {
      let response;
      let filename;

      if (type === 'full') {
        response = await communityService.exportCommunityData(id as string, { format });
        filename = `community-${id}-export.${format}`;
      } else if (type === 'members') {
        response = await communityService.exportMembers(id as string, format);
        filename = `members-${id}.${format}`;
      } else {
        response = await communityService.exportActivity(id as string, format);
        filename = `activity-${id}.${format}`;
      }

      // Create download link
      const blob = format === 'csv'
        ? new Blob([response.data], { type: 'text/csv' })
        : new Blob([JSON.stringify(response.data, null, 2)], { type: 'application/json' });

      const url = window.URL.createObjectURL(blob);
      const a = document.createElement('a');
      a.href = url;
      a.download = filename;
      document.body.appendChild(a);
      a.click();
      window.URL.revokeObjectURL(url);
      document.body.removeChild(a);
    } catch (err: any) {
      alert(err.response?.data?.message || 'Failed to export data');
    } finally {
      setExporting(false);
    }
  }

Assistant2025-11-23T00:15:12.967Z


All tasks are complete. Here's a summary of what was accomplished:


Completed Tasks


1. Feed Service Schema Fixes (Previously completed)


Fixed all SQL schema mismatches in feedComposer.ts:
- requests.requests → requests.help_requests
- helper_id → responder_id
- user_id → requester_id
- Removed non-existent columns (required_skills, expected_duration)


2. Admin UI for Community Settings


    

  • Created admin.tsx with full functionality
    • 

  • 4 tabs: Members, Pending Requests, Settings, Export Data
    • 

  • Member role management (member/moderator/admin)
    • 

  • Pending join request approval/rejection
    • 

  • TTL settings configuration
    • 

  • Karma decay configuration
    • 



3. Admin Link Added


    

  • Added "Admin Settings" button to community detail page (visible only to admins)
    • 



4. claude.md Context Files


Created hierarchical context files for better Claude Code assistance:
- claude.md - Root project overview
- services/claude.md - Backend services guide
- apps/claude.md - Frontend apps overview
- apps/frontend/claude.md - Web app specifics
- apps/mobile/claude.md - Mobile app guide
- infrastructure/claude.md - Docker & DB schemas
- packages/claude.md - Shared packages
- tests/claude.md - Testing guide
- scripts/claude.md - Scripts documentation


5. Mobile App Ready for Testing


Created/fixed all missing mobile app screens:
- Auth screens: login.tsx, register.tsx
- Tab screens: communities.tsx, requests.tsx, messages.tsx, profile.tsx
- Added babel.config.js for expo-router
- Created placeholder assets
- Installed missing dependencies (@expo/vector-icons, expo-device)
- Type check passes


6. Data Export API (JSON/CSV)


    

  • Created export.ts with 3 endpoints:
    • 

  • GET /communities/:id/export - Full community data export
    • 

  • GET /communities/:id/export/members - Members list
    • 

  • GET /communities/:id/export/activity - Activity/karma report
    • 

  • Added export API methods to api.ts
    • 

  • Added "Export Data" tab to admin page with download buttons for JSON/CSV
    •

Assistant2025-11-23T00:21:49.776Z


The issue is that you're running npx expo start from the root directory instead of the mobile app directory. The root is a monorepo and doesn't have react-native installed directly.

feat: add admin UI, data export API, mobile app screens, and claude.md docs

## Admin UI & Data Export
- Created community admin page with member management, pending requests, and settings tabs
- Added data export API (JSON/CSV) for communities, members, and activity reports
- Export routes: /communities/:id/export, /export/members, /export/activity
- Added export tab to admin UI with download buttons

## Feed Service Fixes
- Fixed schema mismatches in feedComposer.ts:
  - requests.requests → requests.help_requests
  - helper_id → responder_id
  - user_id → requester_id
  - Removed non-existent columns (required_skills, expected_duration)

## Mobile App
- Created auth screens: login.tsx, register.tsx
- Created tab screens: communities, requests, messages, profile
- Added babel.config.js for expo-router
- Fixed dependency versions with npx expo install --fix
- Added placeholder assets

## Documentation
- Created hierarchical claude.md context files:
  - Root: Project overview, architecture, commands
  - services/: Backend service patterns
  - apps/: Frontend applications guide
  - apps/frontend/: Next.js specifics
  - apps/mobile/: Expo/React Native guide
  - infrastructure/: Docker & database schemas
  - packages/: Shared code
  - tests/: Testing guide
  - scripts/: Scripts documentation

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

feat: add admin UI, data export API, mobile app screens, and claude.md docs

## Admin UI & Data Export
- Created community admin page with member management, pending requests, and settings tabs
- Added data export API (JSON/CSV) for communities, members, and activity reports
- Export routes: /communities/:id/export, /export/members, /export/activity
- Added export tab to admin UI with download buttons

## Feed Service Fixes
- Fixed schema mismatches in feedComposer.ts:
  - requests.requests → requests.help_requests
  - helper_id → responder_id
  - user_id → requester_id
  - Removed non-existent columns (required_skills, expected_duration)

## Mobile App
- Created auth screens: login.tsx, register.tsx
- Created tab screens: communities, requests, messages, profile
- Added babel.config.js for expo-router
- Fixed dependency versions with npx expo install --fix
- Added placeholder assets

## Documentation
- Created hierarchical claude.md context files:
  - Root: Project overview, architecture, commands
  - services/: Backend service patterns
  - apps/: Frontend applications guide
  - apps/frontend/: Next.js specifics
  - apps/mobile/: Expo/React Native guide
  - infrastructure/: Docker & database schemas
  - packages/: Shared code
  - tests/: Testing guide
  - scripts/: Scripts documentation

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

Assistant2025-11-23T00:37:26.965Z


The Android SDK is not installed on your machine. To test on Android, you have a few options:


Options to Test on Android:


Option 1: Physical Device with Expo Go (Easiest)


    

  1. Install Expo Go from Google Play Store on your Android phone
    2. 

  2. Run this in your terminal:
   bash
   cd apps/mobile
   npx expo start --tunnel
    3. 

  3. Scan the QR code with Expo Go
    4. 



Option 2: Install Android Studio


    

  1. Download Android Studio: https://developer.android.com/studio
    2. 

  2. Install and run through the setup wizard (it will install the SDK)
    3. 

  3. Set environment variable:
   ANDROID_HOME=C:\Users\ravic\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk
    4. 

  4. Add to PATH:
   C:\Users\ravic\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk\platform-tools
    5. 

  5. Create an Android Virtual Device (AVD) in Android Studio
    6. 

  6. Then run: npx expo start --android
    7. 



Option 3: Use Web for Quick Testing


cd apps/mobile
npx expo start --web



This opens the app in your browser (some features won't work but UI is visible).


Would you like me to:
1. Set up Android Studio - Guide you through installation
2. Start with tunnel mode - For physical device testing
3. Start web mode - Quick UI preview in browser
4. Do something else - Move on to other tasks

    40. 



I read the babel.config.js file and confirmed it contains the deprecated plugin that needs to be removed.


    

  1. Optional Next Step:
   Fix the babel.config.js by removing the deprecated expo-router/babel plugin. In SDK 50+, babel-preset-expo already includes expo-router support, so the plugins array should be empty or removed:
   javascript
   module.exports = function (api) {
     api.cache(true);
     return {
       presets: ['babel-preset-expo'],
     };
   };
   Then restart the Expo server to test if the app loads properly..
Please continue the conversation from where we left it off without asking the user any further questions. Continue with the last task that you were asked to work on.

  };
};


+
module.exports = function (api) {
  api.cache(true);
  return {
    presets: ['babel-preset-expo'],
  };
};

Assistant2025-11-23T05:03:25.174Z


The server is running and waiting on http://localhost:8082. The Metro bundler is rebuilding the cache. You can now try to access the app at http://localhost:8082 in your browser.


The blank page issue should be fixed now that I removed the deprecated expo-router/babel plugin from babel.config.js. In Expo SDK 50+, the babel-preset-expo preset already includes expo-router support, so the separate plugin is no longer needed.


Summary of the fix:
- Removed deprecated plugins: ['expo-router/babel'] from babel.config.js
- Cleared the Metro bundler cache with --clear flag
- Restarted the Expo dev server


To test the app:
1. Open http://localhost:8082 in your browser
2. You should see the mobile app's login screen
3. If using an Android/iOS device, scan the QR code with Expo Go

The error is clear now - the EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT environment variable is not being set properly. This is needed by expo-router to know where the app directory is located.

Assistant2025-11-23T05:05:45.209Z


The app.json looks fine, but we need a metro.config.js for expo-router to work properly on the web. This is a known issue with expo-router on Windows where the EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT environment variable isn't being set correctly.


Let me create a metro.config.js file to fix this:


Assistant2025-11-23T05:05:46.423Z


📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\metro.config.js


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\metro.config.js


// Learn more https://docs.expo.io/guides/customizing-metro
const { getDefaultConfig } = require('expo/metro-config');

/** @type {import('expo/metro-config').MetroConfig} */
const config = getDefaultConfig(__dirname);

module.exports = config;





Tool reply2025-11-23T05:05:47.980Z
File created successfully at: c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\metro.config.js

     2→import { useAuthStore } from '@/store/auth';

     4→
     5→export default function Index() {
     6→  const { user, isLoading } = useAuthStore();
     7→
     8→  if (isLoading) {
     9→    return (
    10→      <View style={{ flex: 1, justifyContent: 'center', alignItems: 'center' }}>
    11→        <ActivityIndicator size="large" color="#3B82F6" />
    12→      </View>
    13→    );
    14→  }
    15→
    16→  // Redirect to tabs if authenticated, otherwise to login
    17→  return user ? <Redirect href="/(tabs)/feed" /> : <Redirect href="/(auth)/login" />;
    18→}

Assistant2025-11-23T05:15:56.969Z


The issue is that process.env.EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT is not being set before Metro starts. The fix is to set it in the metro.config.js before expo runs:


Assistant2025-11-23T05:15:59.811Z


✏️ Edit c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\metro.config.js


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\metro.config.js




−
// Learn more https://docs.expo.io/guides/customizing-metro
const { getDefaultConfig } = require('expo/metro-config');

/** @type {import('expo/metro-config').MetroConfig} */
const config = getDefaultConfig(__dirname);

module.exports = config;


+
// Learn more https://docs.expo.io/guides/customizing-metro
const { getDefaultConfig } = require('expo/metro-config');
const path = require('path');

// Set EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT before expo-router uses it
// This fixes the Windows issue where the env var isn't properly set
process.env.EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT = path.resolve(__dirname, 'app');

/** @type {import('expo/metro-config').MetroConfig} */
const config = getDefaultConfig(__dirname);

module.exports = config;






Tool reply2025-11-23T05:16:02.736Z
The file c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\metro.config.js has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
     1→// Learn more https://docs.expo.io/guides/customizing-metro
     2→const { getDefaultConfig } = require('expo/metro-config');
     3→const path = require('path');
     4→
     5→// Set EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT before expo-router uses it
     6→// This fixes the Windows issue where the env var isn't properly set
     7→process.env.EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT = path.resolve(__dirname, 'app');
     8→
     9→/** @type {import('expo/metro-config').MetroConfig} */
    10→const config = getDefaultConfig(__dirname);
    11→
    12→module.exports = config;
    13→

The same error persists. This is a known issue with expo-router on Windows - the environment variable doesn't get passed to the web bundler correctly regardless of how it's set.

Given the persistent issue with expo-router on Windows, if this still doesn't work, there are two alternatives:


    

  1. Test on a real device using Expo Go - This is the recommended way to test React Native apps:
    2. 

  2. Install "Expo Go" from App Store/Play Store on your phone
    3. 

  3. Run npx expo start (without --web)
    4. 

  4. 

    Scan the QR code with your phone
    

    5. 

  5. 

    The web preview has known Windows issues with expo-router - This is a documented issue with expo-router and the web bundler on Windows. The app will work correctly on Android/iOS devices but web preview has path resolution problems.
    

    6.

- Try testing on a physical device with Expo Go?

The app.json looks fine, but we need a metro.config.js for expo-router to work properly on the web. This is a known issue with expo-router on Windows where the EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT environment variable isn't being set correctly.


Let me create a metro.config.js file to fix this:


Assistant2025-11-23T05:05:46.423Z


📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\metro.config.js


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\metro.config.js


// Learn more https://docs.expo.io/guides/customizing-metro
const { getDefaultConfig } = require('expo/metro-config');

/** @type {import('expo/metro-config').MetroConfig} */
const config = getDefaultConfig(__dirname);

module.exports = config;

     1→import { Redirect } from 'expo-router';
     2→import { useAuthStore } from '@/store/auth';
     3→import { View, ActivityIndicator } from 'react-native';
     4→
     5→export default function Index() {
     6→  const { user, isLoading } = useAuthStore();
     7→
     8→  if (isLoading) {
     9→    return (
    10→      <View style={{ flex: 1, justifyContent: 'center', alignItems: 'center' }}>
    11→        <ActivityIndicator size="large" color="#3B82F6" />
    12→      </View>
    13→    );
    14→  }
    15→
    16→  // Redirect to tabs if authenticated, otherwise to login
    17→  return user ? <Redirect href="/(tabs)/feed" /> : <Redirect href="/(auth)/login" />;
    18→}
    19→

Actually, the real fix for this Windows issue is to use a different approach. Let me check what version of expo-router we have and try the proper fix by updating the metro.config.js to explicitly handle the app root:


Assistant2025-11-23T05:15:50.266Z


⚙ Read
{
  "file_path": "c:\\Users\\ravic\\development\\karmyq\\apps\\mobile\\metro.config.js"
}


Tool reply2025-11-23T05:15:52.747Z
     1→// Learn more https://docs.expo.io/guides/customizing-metro
     2→const { getDefaultConfig } = require('expo/metro-config');
     3→
     4→/** @type {import('expo/metro-config').MetroConfig} */
     5→const config = getDefaultConfig(__dirname);
     6→
     7→module.exports = config;
     8→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>



Assistant2025-11-23T05:15:56.969Z


The issue is that process.env.EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT is not being set before Metro starts. The fix is to set it in the metro.config.js before expo runs:


Assistant2025-11-23T05:15:59.811Z


✏️ Edit c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\metro.config.js


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\metro.config.js




−
// Learn more https://docs.expo.io/guides/customizing-metro
const { getDefaultConfig } = require('expo/metro-config');

/** @type {import('expo/metro-config').MetroConfig} */
const config = getDefaultConfig(__dirname);

module.exports = config;


+
// Learn more https://docs.expo.io/guides/customizing-metro
const { getDefaultConfig } = require('expo/metro-config');
const path = require('path');

// Set EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT before expo-router uses it
// This fixes the Windows issue where the env var isn't properly set
process.env.EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT = path.resolve(__dirname, 'app');

/** @type {import('expo/metro-config').MetroConfig} */
const config = getDefaultConfig(__dirname);

module.exports = config;






Tool reply2025-11-23T05:16:02.736Z
The file c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\metro.config.js has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
     1→// Learn more https://docs.expo.io/guides/customizing-metro
     2→const { getDefaultConfig } = require('expo/metro-config');
     3→const path = require('path');
     4→
     5→// Set EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT before expo-router uses it
     6→// This fixes the Windows issue where the env var isn't properly set
     7→process.env.EXPO_ROUTER_APP_ROOT = path.resolve(__dirname, 'app');
     8→
     9→/** @type {import('expo/metro-config').MetroConfig} */
    10→const config = getDefaultConfig(__dirname);
    11→
    12→module.exports = config;

Assistant2025-11-23T05:27:33.079Z


The same error persists. This is a known issue with expo-router on Windows - the environment variable doesn't get passed to the web bundler correctly regardless of how it's set.


Let me try a different approach - using cross-env to ensure the environment variable is properly set on Windows:

For the web preview specifically, there's a known Windows issue with expo-router. The app should work correctly on a physical device through Expo Go.


To test on your physical device:
1. Make sure your phone and computer are on the same WiFi network
2. Install "Expo Go" from Play Store (Android) or App Store (iOS)
3. In your PowerShell, navigate to apps/mobile and run npx expo start
4. Scan the QR code with Expo Go

Assistant2025-11-23T06:23:13.928Z


The upgrade failed due to Node.js version requirements (SDK 54 requires Node >= 20.19.4, you have 20.16.0) and peer dependency conflicts. 


Option 2: Install older Expo Go for SDK 50


Since upgrading requires a newer Node.js version, the easier option is to install an older version of Expo Go that's compatible with SDK 50. Follow the link from the error message, or:


    

  1. On your Android device, uninstall the current Expo Go app
    2. 

  2. Download the SDK 50 compatible version from: https://expo.dev/go?sdkVersion=50&platform=android&device=true
    3. 



Let me revert the partial upgrade and restore SDK 50:

  "name": "@karmyq/mobile",

    2.

Assistant2025-11-23T06:32:10.229Z


You have Node v20.16.0 but SDK 54 requires v20.19.4+. 


To upgrade Node.js on Windows, you have a few options:


    

  1. 

    Using nvm-windows (if installed):
   nvm install 20.19
   nvm use 20.19
    

    2. 

  2. 

    Download directly from nodejs.org:
   Go to https://nodejs.org/en/download/ and download the latest LTS (v22.x or latest v20.x)
    

    3. 

  3. 

    Using Chocolatey (if installed):
   choco upgrade nodejs-lts
    

    4. 



Let me check if you have nvm-windows installed:

nvm --version 2>nul || echo "nvm not installed"

    2.

    3. 

  3. Run the installer
    4. 

  4. Close and reopen your terminal after installation
    5.

  1. Test on a physical device (recommended):
    2.

    5. 

  5. 

    Access the dev server:
    

    6. 

  6. Open http://localhost:8081 in your browser for the Expo web interface
    7. 



For the web preview specifically, there's a known Windows issue with expo-router. The app should work correctly on a physical device through Expo Go.


To test on your physical device:
1. Make sure your phone and computer are on the same WiFi network
2. Install "Expo Go" from Play Store (Android) or App Store (iOS)
3. In your PowerShell, navigate to apps/mobile and run npx expo start
4. Scan the QR code with Expo Go


Would you like to:
- Try testing on a physical device with Expo Go?
- Commit the mobile app changes we've made so far and move on?

Assistant2025-11-23T06:23:13.928Z


The upgrade failed due to Node.js version requirements (SDK 54 requires Node >= 20.19.4, you have 20.16.0) and peer dependency conflicts. 


Option 2: Install older Expo Go for SDK 50


Since upgrading requires a newer Node.js version, the easier option is to install an older version of Expo Go that's compatible with SDK 50. Follow the link from the error message, or:


    

  1. On your Android device, uninstall the current Expo Go app
    2. 

  2. Download the SDK 50 compatible version from: https://expo.dev/go?sdkVersion=50&platform=android&device=true
    3.

The warnings show that expo SDK 54 is still installed (from root node_modules or global), but the mobile app dependencies are SDK 50. 


To test on your phone with Expo Go for SDK 50:


    

  1. First, you need to install the SDK 50 compatible version of Expo Go on your device:
    2. 

  2. Android: https://expo.dev/go?sdkVersion=50&platform=android&device=true
    3. 

  3. 

    iOS: https://expo.dev/go?sdkVersion=50&platform=ios&device=true
    

    4. 

  4. 

    Or update to the latest Expo Go and upgrade your Node.js to v20.19.4+ to use SDK 54
    

    5.

- The Expo server is running at http://localhost:8081
- Your Expo Go app is SDK 54, but the project is SDK 50
- You need either an older Expo Go or to upgrade Node.js first

Assistant2025-11-23T06:32:10.229Z


You have Node v20.16.0 but SDK 54 requires v20.19.4+. 


To upgrade Node.js on Windows, you have a few options:


    

  1. 

    Using nvm-windows (if installed):
   nvm install 20.19
   nvm use 20.19
    

    2. 

  2. 

    Download directly from nodejs.org:
   Go to https://nodejs.org/en/download/ and download the latest LTS (v22.x or latest v20.x)
    

    3. 

  3. 

    Using Chocolatey (if installed):
   choco upgrade nodejs-lts
    

    4. 



Let me check if you have nvm-windows installed:


Assistant2025-11-23T06:32:10.887Z




$ Bash


Check if nvm is installed
nvm --version 2>nul || echo "nvm not installed"




Tool reply2025-11-23T06:32:15.663Z
nvm not installed


Assistant2025-11-23T06:32:22.067Z


nvm is not installed. You'll need to manually upgrade Node.js:


    

  1. Go to https://nodejs.org/en/download/
    2. 

  2. Download Node.js v22.x LTS (or at minimum v20.19.4)
    3. 

  3. Run the installer
    4. 

  4. Close and reopen your terminal after installation
    5. 



Once you've upgraded Node.js, let me know and I'll:
1. Clean up the mobile app dependencies
2. Upgrade to SDK 54
3. Start the dev server


Alternatively, if you want to proceed without upgrading Node.js right now, we can:
- Install the SDK 50 compatible Expo Go app on your device instead
- Or commit what we have and come back to testing later


Which would you prefer?

Assistant2025-11-23T07:17:27.849Z


The root package.json doesn't have expo packages - they're being hoisted from the mobile app because of workspaces. The fix is to configure npm to not hoist expo packages. Let me create an .npmrc file to prevent hoisting of expo-related packages:


Assistant2025-11-23T07:17:29.351Z


📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\.npmrc


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\.npmrc


legacy-peer-deps=true
# Prevent expo packages from being hoisted to root to avoid version conflicts
hoist-pattern[]=!expo*
hoist-pattern[]=!@expo/*
hoist-pattern[]=!react-native*
hoist-pattern[]=!@react-native/*





Tool reply2025-11-23T07:17:35.212Z
File created successfully at: c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\.npmrc

Expo SDK 54 is now running!


The dev server is available at http://localhost:8081


To test on your phone:
1. Open the Expo Go app on your Android device (the SDK 54 version you already have)
2. Scan the QR code that appears in your terminal, OR
3. Open http://localhost:8081 in your browser to see the dev interface

Assistant2025-11-23T07:24:43.399Z


The Expo server is running in a background process that I control. You can access the app in two ways:


Option 1: Open in your browser
Go to http://localhost:8081 in your web browser - this will show the Expo dev tools where you can see a QR code.


Option 2: Start Expo in your own terminal
If you want to see the QR code directly, open a new PowerShell/terminal and run:


cd C:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile
npx expo start



Let me kill my background servers first so they don't conflict:


Assistant2025-11-23T07:24:44.210Z

Tool reply2025-11-23T07:42:04.924Z


Assistant2025-11-23T07:42:16.152Z


📝 Write c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\store\auth.ts


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\store\auth.ts


import { create } from 'zustand';
import * as SecureStore from 'expo-secure-store';

interface User {
  id: string;
  email: string;
  name: string;
}

interface AuthState {
  user: User | null;
  token: string | null;
  isLoading: boolean;
  login: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;
  register: (name: string, email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;
  logout: () => Promise<void>;
  checkAuth: () => Promise<void>;
}

const API_URL = process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_API_URL || 'http://localhost:3001';

export const useAuthStore = create<AuthState>((set, get) => ({
  user: null,
  token: null,
  isLoading: true,

  login: async (email: string, password: string) => {
    try {
      const response = await fetch(`${API_URL}/api/auth/login`, {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email, password }),
      });

      const data = await response.json();

      if (!response.ok) {
        throw new Error(data.message || 'Login failed');
      }

      await SecureStore.setItemAsync('token', data.token);
      set({ user: data.user, token: data.token });
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Login error:', error);
      throw error;
    }
  },

  register: async (name: string, email: string, password: string) => {
    try {
      const response = await fetch(`${API_URL}/api/auth/register`, {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
        body: JSON.stringify({ name, email, password }),
      });

      const data = await response.json();

      if (!response.ok) {
        throw new Error(data.message || 'Registration failed');
      }

      await SecureStore.setItemAsync('token', data.token);
      set({ user: data.user, token: data.token });
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Register error:', error);
      throw error;
    }
  },

  logout: async () => {
    await SecureStore.deleteItemAsync('token');
    set({ user: null, token: null });
  },

  checkAuth: async () => {
    try {
      const token = await SecureStore.getItemAsync('token');

      if (!token) {
        set({ isLoading: false });
        return;
      }

      const response = await fetch(`${API_URL}/api/auth/me`, {
        headers: { Authorization: `Bearer ${token}` },
      });

      if (response.ok) {
        const data = await response.json();
        set({ user: data.user, token, isLoading: false });
      } else {
        await SecureStore.deleteItemAsync('token');
        set({ user: null, token: null, isLoading: false });
      }
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Auth check error:', error);
      set({ isLoading: false });
    }
  },
}));





Tool reply2025-11-23T07:42:16.800Z

Assistant2025-11-23T07:42:28.120Z




$ Bash


Create auth store
cat > /c/Users/ravic/development/karmyq/apps/mobile/store/auth.ts << 'EOF'
import { create } from 'zustand';
import * as SecureStore from 'expo-secure-store';

interface User {
  id: string;
  email: string;
  name: string;
}

interface AuthState {
  user: User | null;
  token: string | null;
  isLoading: boolean;
  login: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;
  register: (name: string, email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;
  logout: () => Promise<void>;
  checkAuth: () => Promise<void>;
}

const API_URL = process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_API_URL || 'http://localhost:3001';

export const useAuthStore = create<AuthState>((set, get) => ({
  user: null,
  token: null,
  isLoading: true,

  login: async (email: string, password: string) => {
    try {
      const response = await fetch(`${API_URL}/api/auth/login`, {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
        body: JSON.stringify({ email, password }),
      });

      const data = await response.json();

      if (!response.ok) {
        throw new Error(data.message || 'Login failed');
      }

      await SecureStore.setItemAsync('token', data.token);
      set({ user: data.user, token: data.token });
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Login error:', error);
      throw error;
    }
  },

  register: async (name: string, email: string, password: string) => {
    try {
      const response = await fetch(`${API_URL}/api/auth/register`, {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
        body: JSON.stringify({ name, email, password }),
      });

      const data = await response.json();

      if (!response.ok) {
        throw new Error(data.message || 'Registration failed');
      }

      await SecureStore.setItemAsync('token', data.token);
      set({ user: data.user, token: data.token });
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Register error:', error);
      throw error;
    }
  },

  logout: async () => {
    await SecureStore.deleteItemAsync('token');
    set({ user: null, token: null });
  },

  checkAuth: async () => {
    try {
      const token = await SecureStore.getItemAsync('token');

      if (!token) {
        set({ isLoading: false });
        return;
      }

      const response = await fetch(`${API_URL}/api/auth/me`, {
        headers: { Authorization: `Bearer ${token}` },
      });

      if (response.ok) {
        const data = await response.json();
        set({ user: data.user, token, isLoading: false });
      } else {
        await SecureStore.deleteItemAsync('token');
        set({ user: null, token: null, isLoading: false });
      }
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Auth check error:', error);
      set({ isLoading: false });
    }
  },
}));
EOF




Tool reply2025-11-23T07:42:35.063Z


Assistant2025-11-23T07:42:44.390Z




$ Bash


Create notifications service
cat > /c/Users/ravic/development/karmyq/apps/mobile/services/notifications.ts << 'EOF'
import * as Notifications from 'expo-notifications';
import * as Device from 'expo-device';
import { Platform } from 'react-native';

Notifications.setNotificationHandler({
  handleNotification: async () => ({
    shouldShowAlert: true,
    shouldPlaySound: true,
    shouldSetBadge: true,
  }),
});

export async function registerForPushNotificationsAsync(): Promise<string | null> {
  let token: string | null = null;

  if (Platform.OS === 'android') {
    await Notifications.setNotificationChannelAsync('default', {
      name: 'default',
      importance: Notifications.AndroidImportance.MAX,
      vibrationPattern: [0, 250, 250, 250],
      lightColor: '#FF231F7C',
    });
  }

  if (Device.isDevice) {
    const { status: existingStatus } = await Notifications.getPermissionsAsync();
    let finalStatus = existingStatus;

    if (existingStatus !== 'granted') {
      const { status } = await Notifications.requestPermissionsAsync();
      finalStatus = status;
    }

    if (finalStatus !== 'granted') {
      console.log('Failed to get push token for push notification!');
      return null;
    }

    token = (await Notifications.getExpoPushTokenAsync()).data;
  } else {
    console.log('Must use physical device for Push Notifications');
  }

  return token;
}

export function setupNotificationHandlers() {
  // Handle notifications received while app is foregrounded
  Notifications.addNotificationReceivedListener((notification) => {
    console.log('Notification received:', notification);
  });

  // Handle notification taps
  Notifications.addNotificationResponseReceivedListener((response) => {
    console.log('Notification tapped:', response);
    // Navigate to appropriate screen based on notification data
    const data = response.notification.request.content.data;
    if (data?.type) {
      // Handle navigation based on notification type
      console.log('Navigate to:', data.type);
    }
  });
}
EOF

Assistant2025-11-23T07:43:12.384Z


The babel config needs the module-resolver plugin for the @/ alias to work at runtime. Let me update it:


Assistant2025-11-23T07:43:14.473Z


✏️ Edit c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\babel.config.js


c:\Users\ravic\development\karmyq\apps\mobile\babel.config.js




−
module.exports = function (api) {
  api.cache(true);
  return {
    presets: ['babel-preset-expo'],
  };
};


+
module.exports = function (api) {
  api.cache(true);
  return {
    presets: ['babel-preset-expo'],
    plugins: [
      [
        'module-resolver',
        {
          root: ['./'],
          alias: {
            '@': './',
            '@/components': './components',
            '@/hooks': './hooks',
            '@/services': './services',
            '@/store': './store',
            '@/types': './types',
            '@/utils': './utils',
          },
        },
      ],
    ],
  };
};

Tool reply2025-11-23T07:55:31.925Z

     1→import { Tabs } from 'expo-router';
     2→import { Ionicons } from '@expo/vector-icons';
     3→
     4→export default function TabLayout() {
     5→  return (
     6→    <Tabs
     7→      screenOptions={{
     8→        tabBarActiveTintColor: '#3B82F6',
     9→        tabBarInactiveTintColor: '#9CA3AF',
    10→        headerStyle: {
    11→          backgroundColor: '#3B82F6',
    12→        },
    13→        headerTintColor: '#fff',
    14→        headerTitleStyle: {
    15→          fontWeight: 'bold',
    16→        },
    17→      }}
    18→    >
    19→      <Tabs.Screen
    20→        name="feed"
    21→        options={{
    22→          title: 'Feed',
    23→          tabBarIcon: ({ color, size }) => (
    24→            <Ionicons name="home" size={size} color={color} />
    25→          ),
    26→        }}
    27→      />
    28→      <Tabs.Screen
    29→        name="communities"
    30→        options={{
    31→          title: 'Communities',

    34→          ),
    35→        }}
    36→      />

    38→        name="requests"
    39→        options={{
    40→          title: 'Requests',
    41→          tabBarIcon: ({ color, size }) => (

    44→        }}
    45→      />

    47→        name="messages"

    60→            <Ionicons name="person" size={size} color={color} />
    61→          ),
    62→        }}
    63→      />
    64→    </Tabs>
    65→  );
    66→}

Assistant2025-11-23T07:55:51.629Z

{
  "file_path": "c:\\Users\\ravic\\development\\karmyq\\apps\\mobile\\app\\(tabs)\\feed.tsx"

Tool reply2025-11-23T07:55:55.842Z
     1→import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
     2→import {
     3→  View,
     4→  Text,
     5→  FlatList,
     6→  StyleSheet,
     7→  RefreshControl,
     8→  TouchableOpacity,
     9→  ActivityIndicator,
    10→} from 'react-native';
    11→import { Ionicons } from '@expo/vector-icons';
    12→import { router } from 'expo-router';
    13→import { api } from '@/services/api';
    14→import { useAuthStore } from '@/store/auth';
    15→
    16→interface FeedItem {
    17→  id: string;
    18→  type: string;
    19→  data: any;
    20→  created_at: string;
    21→}
    22→
    23→export default function FeedScreen() {
    24→  const { user } = useAuthStore();
    25→  const [feedItems, setFeedItems] = useState<FeedItem[]>([]);
    26→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
    27→  const [refreshing, setRefreshing] = useState(false);
    28→
    29→  const loadFeed = async () => {
    30→    if (!user) return;
    31→
    32→    try {
    33→      const response = await api.getFeed(user.id);
    34→      setFeedItems(response.data.items || []);
    35→    } catch (error) {
    36→      console.error('Failed to load feed:', error);
    37→    } finally {
    38→      setLoading(false);
    39→      setRefreshing(false);
    40→    }
    41→  };
    42→
    43→  useEffect(() => {
    44→    loadFeed();
    45→  }, [user]);
    46→
    47→  const onRefresh = () => {
    48→    setRefreshing(true);
    49→    loadFeed();
    50→  };
    51→
    52→  const renderFeedItem = ({ item }: { item: FeedItem }) => {
    53→    return (
    54→      <TouchableOpacity
    55→        style={styles.feedItem}
    56→        onPress={() => {
    57→          // Navigate to detail screen based on item type
    58→          if (item.type === 'open_request') {
    59→            router.push(`/requests/${item.data.request_id}`);
    60→          }
    61→        }}
    62→      >
    63→        <View style={styles.feedItemHeader}>
    64→          <Ionicons
    65→            name={getFeedItemIcon(item.type)}
    66→            size={24}
    67→            color="#3B82F6"
    68→          />
    69→          <Text style={styles.feedItemType}>{item.type.replace('_', ' ')}</Text>
    70→        </View>
    71→        <Text style={styles.feedItemTitle}>
    72→          {item.data.title || item.data.description}
    73→        </Text>
    74→        {item.data.community_name && (
    75→          <Text style={styles.feedItemCommunity}>
    76→            {item.data.community_name}
    77→          </Text>
    78→        )}
    79→      </TouchableOpacity>
    80→    );
    81→  };
    82→
    83→  const renderEmptyState = () => (
    84→    <View style={styles.emptyState}>
    85→      <Ionicons name="newspaper-outline" size={64} color="#9CA3AF" />
    86→      <Text style={styles.emptyStateTitle}>Your feed is empty</Text>
    87→      <Text style={styles.emptyStateText}>
    88→        Join communities and start helping to see activity here!
    89→      </Text>
    90→      <TouchableOpacity
    91→        style={styles.emptyStateButton}
    92→        onPress={() => router.push('/(tabs)/communities')}
    93→      >
    94→        <Text style={styles.emptyStateButtonText}>Explore Communities</Text>
    95→      </TouchableOpacity>
    96→    </View>
    97→  );
    98→
    99→  if (loading) {
   100→    return (
   101→      <View style={styles.loadingContainer}>
   102→        <ActivityIndicator size="large" color="#3B82F6" />
   103→      </View>
   104→    );
   105→  }
   106→
   107→  return (
   108→    <View style={styles.container}>
   109→      <FlatList
   110→        data={feedItems}
   111→        renderItem={renderFeedItem}
   112→        keyExtractor={(item) => item.id}
   113→        ListEmptyComponent={renderEmptyState}
   114→        refreshControl={
   115→          <RefreshControl refreshing={refreshing} onRefresh={onRefresh} />
   116→        }
   117→        contentContainerStyle={feedItems.length === 0 ? styles.emptyList : undefined}
   118→      />
   119→    </View>
   120→  );
   121→}
   122→
   123→function getFeedItemIcon(type: string): any {
   124→  switch (type) {
   125→    case 'community_activity':
   126→      return 'people';
   127→    case 'open_request':
   128→      return 'hand-right';
   129→    case 'suggested_request':
   130→      return 'bulb';
   131→    case 'story':
   132→      return 'trophy';
   133→    default:
   134→      return 'information-circle';
   135→  }
   136→}
   137→
   138→const styles = StyleSheet.create({
   139→  container: {
   140→    flex: 1,
   141→    backgroundColor: '#F3F4F6',
   142→  },
   143→  loadingContainer: {
   144→    flex: 1,
   145→    justifyContent: 'center',
   146→    alignItems: 'center',
   147→  },
   148→  feedItem: {
   149→    backgroundColor: '#FFFFFF',
   150→    padding: 16,
   151→    marginHorizontal: 16,
   152→    marginVertical: 8,
   153→    borderRadius: 8,
   154→    shadowColor: '#000',
   155→    shadowOffset: { width: 0, height: 1 },
   156→    shadowOpacity: 0.1,
   157→    shadowRadius: 2,
   158→    elevation: 2,
   159→  },
   160→  feedItemHeader: {
   161→    flexDirection: 'row',
   162→    alignItems: 'center',
   163→    marginBottom: 8,
   164→  },
   165→  feedItemType: {
   166→    fontSize: 12,
   167→    color: '#6B7280',
   168→    marginLeft: 8,
   169→    textTransform: 'capitalize',
   170→  },
   171→  feedItemTitle: {
   172→    fontSize: 16,
   173→    fontWeight: '600',
   174→    color: '#111827',
   175→    marginBottom: 4,
   176→  },
   177→  feedItemCommunity: {
   178→    fontSize: 14,
   179→    color: '#6B7280',
   180→  },
   181→  emptyList: {
   182→    flexGrow: 1,
   183→  },
   184→  emptyState: {
   185→    flex: 1,
   186→    justifyContent: 'center',
   187→    alignItems: 'center',
   188→    padding: 32,
   189→  },
   190→  emptyStateTitle: {
   191→    fontSize: 20,
   192→    fontWeight: 'bold',
   193→    color: '#111827',
   194→    marginTop: 16,
   195→    marginBottom: 8,
   196→  },
   197→  emptyStateText: {
   198→    fontSize: 14,
   199→    color: '#6B7280',
   200→    textAlign: 'center',
   201→    marginBottom: 24,
   202→  },
   203→  emptyStateButton: {
   204→    backgroundColor: '#3B82F6',
   205→    paddingHorizontal: 24,
   206→    paddingVertical: 12,
   207→    borderRadius: 8,
   208→  },
   209→  emptyStateButtonText: {
   210→    color: '#FFFFFF',
   211→    fontSize: 16,
   212→    fontWeight: '600',
   213→  },
   214→});
   215→

Assistant2025-11-23T07:56:00.887Z


The feed.tsx imports @/services/api which doesn't exist. Let me create it:


Assistant2025-11-23T07:56:09.309Z




$ Bash


Create API service
cat > /c/Users/ravic/development/karmyq/apps/mobile/services/api.ts << 'EOF'
import axios from 'axios';
import * as SecureStore from 'expo-secure-store';

const API_URL = process.env.EXPO_PUBLIC_API_URL || 'http://localhost:3001';

const apiClient = axios.create({
  baseURL: API_URL,
  headers: {
    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  },
});

// Add auth token to requests
apiClient.interceptors.request.use(async (config) => {
  const token = await SecureStore.getItemAsync('token');
  if (token) {
    config.headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${token}`;
  }
  return config;
});

export const api = {
  // Auth
  login: (email: string, password: string) =>
    apiClient.post('/api/auth/login', { email, password }),

  register: (name: string, email: string, password: string) =>
    apiClient.post('/api/auth/register', { name, email, password }),

  getProfile: () => apiClient.get('/api/auth/me'),

  // Feed
  getFeed: (userId: string) =>
    apiClient.get(`/api/feed/user/${userId}`),

  // Communities
  getCommunities: () => apiClient.get('/api/communities'),

  getCommunity: (id: string) => apiClient.get(`/api/communities/${id}`),

  joinCommunity: (id: string) =>
    apiClient.post(`/api/communities/${id}/join`),

  leaveCommunity: (id: string) =>
    apiClient.post(`/api/communities/${id}/leave`),

  // Requests
  getRequests: (communityId?: string) => {
    const params = communityId ? { community_id: communityId } : {};
    return apiClient.get('/api/requests', { params });
  },

  getRequest: (id: string) => apiClient.get(`/api/requests/${id}`),

  createRequest: (data: {
    title: string;
    description: string;
    community_id: string;
    category?: string;
  }) => apiClient.post('/api/requests', data),

  offerHelp: (requestId: string, message?: string) =>
    apiClient.post(`/api/requests/${requestId}/offer`, { message }),

  // Messages
  getConversations: () => apiClient.get('/api/messages/conversations'),

  getMessages: (conversationId: string) =>
    apiClient.get(`/api/messages/conversations/${conversationId}`),

  sendMessage: (conversationId: string, content: string) =>
    apiClient.post(`/api/messages/conversations/${conversationId}`, { content }),

  // Notifications
  getNotifications: () => apiClient.get('/api/notifications'),

  markNotificationRead: (id: string) =>
    apiClient.put(`/api/notifications/${id}/read`),

  // Reputation
  getKarma: (userId: string) =>
    apiClient.get(`/api/reputation/karma/${userId}`),

  getTrustScore: (userId: string) =>
    apiClient.get(`/api/reputation/trust/${userId}`),
};

export default api;
EOF
